We want to foster an environment where individuals can come together to share knowledge and build on the ideas of others. Our motivation to start this group is to incorporate "Design Thinking" into our meetups.

The big thing about design thinking is it allows people to build on the ideas of others. Instead of just having that one thread, you think about it, I come up with an idea, and then somebody from somewhere else says, "Oh that makes me think we should do this and then we could do that." And then you get to a place that you just can't get to in one mind.
-David Kelly, Founder of IDEO

results.description:
This is for those who want to explore the world of film through the purest form. Which would be low-no budget films. Create a Hindi cinema that hasn't been explored before; that is short Hindi film group. Bollywood influenced. If you are a high school student, or a scientist that would love to play a role in a piece of creation that has the power to entertain, make people feel and emote... then lets try to make some cool stories come onto screen.

DANCE meet ups for all those who are looking for a reason to dance, we can dance to Bollywood songs through different styles of dance to put something together. Bring your own creativity into the group, and present your ideas. Showcase it ourselves, maybe organize a show? I don't know! Lets go crazy, because this is the city where everything is accepted. NYC!

Collaboration of MUSIC: If you are a pianist, guitarist, composer, or singer(English/Hindi) we can have a meet and try to make something together. Composers can create music, and musicians can try to execute it through instrument or voice. We can have karaoke sessions to showcase singing talent or practice it yourself. Try to sing your favorite songs of favorite singers. If you play an instrument then practice and perform a song that you like!

Acting, and dancing isn't all that this page is about. If you write stories, then we can shape it into a cinematic script. If you love to capture beautiful footage of people, documenting life, actions, or reactions then you may have a really good eye for shooting a scene. If you are a DJ, or a synthesizer, then you must have a good idea of what music goes with a certain mood/feeling and that could work great as a music director/composer. And if you feel you can put all this together creatively then film direction.

Film comes with a lot more in the package: Lighting, Sound recording on set or in studio, script supervising(making sure that each scene is being shot according to the script or within the limits of the theme so it doesn't sway away), production designer/Art director(looking for the best locations for each scene, setting up the look of the room or location, deciding props that should be used by the actors), if you love to do make up, or design clothes and a lot more. Film is a collaborative medium and the best part about it is that a bunch of people come together to do what they all do best.
results.name: BollyArt: Hindi Films, Dance, and Music

results.description:
'Join survivors of female genital mutilation (FGM) also known as female circumcision.

And supporters against the practice as we discuss FGM in New York and the world.

And, come together to put an end to this practice that mutilates a girl every 16 seconds.

There are currently 140 million mutilated women worldwide, over 300,000 of them are in the United States.'

Founder of 'End Female Genital Mutilation' meetup group.

 

 

We are a small group.

So, we will be concentrating on how to find and publicize solutions to preventing FGM.

If you know of any successes - please email me - or, join this group.

 

Kind regards.

 

Bobbie.

[Organizer.]

 

 

Please also click on Pages to read Pages about Ayaan Hirsi Ali and Warris Dirie and their Foundations.

 

Please note: that while this meetup.com group, 'End Female Genital Mutilation', publicizes these Foundations, and their endeavours, this group is not a part of either of these Foundations.

 

For more information, on the AHA Foundation, please click on:

theahafoundation.org/issues/female-genital-mutilation/

And: theahafoundation.org/about/

And: theahafoundation.org/get-involved/start-a-local-chapter/

 

If you or someone else needs help then you can go to: theahafoundation.org/get-help/

And, Download the AHA Resource Directory.

 

If you know of any other good organisations, that we can publicize and support, please join this group or email me.
results.name: End Female Genital Mutilation

results.description:
We are a group of dedicated road cyclists, with some of us training for organized rides and/or races.

We welcome all newcomers, but we ask that you have a functioning road bike (No folding bikes, cruisers, or other leisure-type bikes) and be able to average at least 13 mph.

 

 

We offer early morning rides in Prospect Park and beyond during the week, as well as longer rides on weekends.

Rides aren’t “led” (please bring your own cue sheet) - they’re just times to meet up with some good folks and ride. Ride distance and pace will vary depending on who shows up.

There will still be plenty of opportunities to stop for coffee/lunch and regroup

Group ride rules and guidelines:

Please follow these!  Otherwise you may be asked not to ride with us.

***We welcome all newcomers, but we ask that you have a functioning road bike (No folding bikes, cruisers, or other leisure-type bikes) and be able to average at least 13 mph***

  • You’re responsible for yourself and your own safety, as well as that of others; always ride smart, ride safe
  • Wear a helmet
  • Ensure that your bicycle is safe and serviceable
  • On rides where we use a cue sheet, please make sure you have a copy of the cue sheet, whether printed or on a GPS device and readily accessible as to orient yourself at anytime
  • No headphones, ear buds, radios or similar audio devices during the ride...it's not safe!
  • Be considerate of slower and faster riders around you; remember that this is a fun ride, NOT a race
  • Be careful, signal, and let others know when you’re slowing or stopping.
  • Avoid sudden sideways movements while riding in a group; be predictable and always hold your line.
results.name: South Brooklyn Velo

results.description: Starting to learn Ruby and Rails? This group is for Ruby, Rails, and programming beginners looking to get together and learn from each other. At this meetup, there won't be an expert walking around, helping you overcome roadblocks by giving you the solution. Instead, this group aims to be a gathering of the 'blind', those of us starting on the journey towards becoming developers, working together to share insights and knowledge. Bring a project you've been working on. Bring a Hacker News article you want to share. Bring a list of reference guides or railscasts that may help your fellow 'blind.' Most importantly, bring a desire to work with your fellow travelers on the path to a programming future. Let's code!
results.name: Ruby Blind

results.description: We are a group of warm-hearted Buddhist practitioners studying Mahayana & Vajrayana Buddhism. We provide newcomers to Buddhism as well as established practitioners an opportunity to study, cultivate, learn practices and meditate. Buddhism provides us with tools to discover the true nature of reality as we analyze and reflect upon our lives to understand the causes and conditions that shape the world around us, discover how to uproot negative emotions and habitual patterns, and learn how to cultivate true inner beauty, happiness and peace of mind. We study teachings and learn ancient practices that show us how to: * Purify negative karma and cultivate pure positive karma * Remove inner and outer obstacles that block worldly and spiritual goals * Uproot negative emotions and habitual patterns * Meditate and cultivate a stable mind * Train the mind in loving-kindness and compassion * Cultivate true inner beauty, happiness and peace of mind Our deep explorations of Mahayana and Vajrayana Buddhism through cultivation practices, discussions and meditation are shaped by ongoing teachings of Lama Namnang Mingjo Dorje Rinpoche, a humble but highly cultivated Chinese Vajrayana yogi, as well as various Tibetan Buddhist teachers. Come join a friendly group as we support each other in this essential journey through online communication and face-to-face meetings. We look forward to meeting you! Peace, Michelle, Pailin and Susan
results.name: Transform Your Mind and Life: Buddhist Study & Meditation

Want to know what it means to be an Intrapreneur, here's a great Forbes article on the topic - http://www.forbes.com/sites/onmarketing/2012/05/21/move-over-entrepreneurs-here-come-the-intrapreneurs/. results.description:
Come and learn to make tasty and healthy Japanese delicacies!

You will learn how easy it is to create tasty Japanese food without going through complicated procedures. Certain key techniques will be demonstrated.

In Japanese cuisine there is more emphasis on freshness and seasonality of the ingredients. The huge variety of seasonal foods results in an appreciation of when the different foods are in season and their suitability for providing satisfaction at the time of year when their quality is at its best. Care is taken to make the prepared foods very digestible. Lightness and transparency through fine simplicity is my favourite part of a Japanese meal.

I choose a specifically practical approach for teaching technique, so you will be pleasantly surprised at how easily fine flavor and visual delight can be achieved at your own home after my cooking class.

The most important thing in my class is that you are having fun while you learn. After cooking is done, you will enjoy the dishes you cooked. The cooking classes are held in the East Village.

The price of each class is around 50 dollars. Please contact at info@tokyotwilight.com for more details. Private, semi private or group classes are also available. Thank you.

My recipes have been published by Oyshee (Rakuten) - you can find them here: http://recipe.rakuten.com/
results.name: Healthy friendly Japanese cooking classes

results.description:
Philosophy and Our Lives is a NYC meetup that dwells in the tension between individual life, lived for the first and last time, and civilization as a shared creation over generations. Can philosophy be of any value to our being in this world?

We read and discuss the uniqueness of the present moment - the philosophy of our time - through the lens of thinkers such as Nietzsche, Camus, Sartre, Adorno, De Beauvoir, Benjamin, Kant, Kierkegaard, Spinoza, Husserl, Habermas, Levinas, Kafka, Althusser, Buber, Hegel, Foucault, Baudrillard, Zizek, Lyotard, Arendt, Heidegger and others.

Philosophy is a relentless interweaving of the actual and the potential. Anyone who is interested in metaphysical questions such as and now what? is welcome to join and engage in ideas!
results.name: Philosophy and Our Lives

results.description:
SPORTS MARKETING CLASSES

 Are you looking to learn more about the sports marketing industry? We will discuss the many jobs you can have working at a team, a league, a brand, an agency and much more! This class will be instructional with plenty of time for your questions as well.

HERE ARE ALL OF OUR CURRENT CLASS OFFERINGS:

· INTRO TO SPORTS MARKETING (101)

· INTRO TO SPORTS SPONSORSHIP (201)

· A LOOK INSIDE SPORTS MARKETING AGENCIES (201)

· INTRO TO TWITTER  FOR #SPORTSBIZ (101)

· RESUME & COVER LETTERS, INTERVIEWS & EFFECTIVE INFORMATIONAL INTERVIEWS FOR SPORTS BUSINESS  (201)


Classes are limited to 10 students per class. Reservations can be made at meetup.com and once made, there is no waiving of the class registration fee unless a student cancels at least 2 days prior to class day.  Our classes sell out so payment is due if online reservations are made via meetup.com. Thank you.

All classes are taught by former NYU Sports Marketing Adjunct Professor & 20-year sports business industry executive: Jennifer Karpf, Director, National Sports Marketing Network (NSMN) - the sports business industry trade association. Learn more at www.sportsmarketingnetwork.com and www.jenniferkarpf.com.

Classes require advance reservations. Seats are limited. $25 per person. Please RSVP at www.meetup.com for the next class we are teaching.

Email classes@sportsmarketingnetwork.com for more information.

results.description: A discussion and social group for academics and non academics interested in the scientific study of consciousness. What is consciousness? We all know the immediate experience of what it is to be conscious, but from a scientific perspective what on earth it is!? Is it as Francis Cricks "Astonishing Hypothesis" suggests - a phenomena completely explainable as the result of complex neuronal interactions, or is it a quantum mechanical phenomena ? Perhaps its a self-referential computer program running in the brain, or just an elaborate illusion - or is consciousness actually the ultimate underpinning of all reality... ? So far little consensus has been achieved on which of these wildly diverse approaches (if any) is correct. However, ongoing improvements in brain scanning technologies and developments in artificial intelligence ensure that the field continues to rapidly evolve, so the future promises some exciting developments! The group will provide a forum to review and informally discuss some of these wide ranging theories with video viewings and book reviews and also (hopefully) some in person lectures from local experts (given that NYC academic institutions are a hotbed of neuroscience and the philosophy of mind). We'll also discuss some of the potential implications of a successful scientific theory and what kind of tools it might lead to for enhancing consciousness in the future.
results.name: Astonishing Hypothesis - science of consciousness meetup

The Understand Men NY PAX Community is a group of volunteers whose lives have been profoundly impacted by the courses from PAX Programs.

We have free co‐ed classes and events in the NY area for anyone interested in improving their relationships with the op osite sex.
We also have events just for graduates of the courses to connect and support each other in implementing their new skills in their lives.
We have such an amazing NY community —generous, happy, appreciative, receptive, giving, contributing people who want to help others.

PAX Programs has been teaching courses to help people have more rewarding relationships with the opposite sex since 1995.  PAX, the Latin word for “peace”, and creates peace between the sexes by providing unique and immediately useful information and tools to women and men.  They have taught thousands of people through their Understanding Men and Understanding Women Courses.

If you would like to learn more about what brings us together, check out the “Free stuff” section on  UnderstandMen.com

Hope to see you at an event!

Understand Men NY Volunteer Team

Rahway River Trout Unlimited is one of the newest New Jersey Trout Unlimited chapters. We are an organization of men and women that strive to protect our cold freshwater fisheries throughout the state. Our members meet once a month, discuss many topics from conservation to fishing. We also go on fishing trips throughout the year, conduct river cleanups, host fly tying events, and partake in many other activities. If you like fishing or just want to give back to the environment then RRTU is for you. So tell a friend, come on out and enjoy yourself, learn a few new things, meet some new fishing buddies, and perhaps even consider joining our Trout Unlimited Chapter - #155.

There are no meetup membership dues. All you need to do is come to a meeting and participate! All are welcome, whether you're an old pro or new to the sport. We do encourage members to join Trout Unlimited to support efforts to improve fish habitat and promote the sport of fly fishing.

results.description:
Calling All Entrepreneurs and people in Small Business.

Are you curious about getting your business to thrive, and with more ease?

This will be the premier business networking and educational group in NY.

Our members are entrepreneurs, small business owners, investors, and those starting businesses, who want to network and collaborate with others, and also learn tools to grow their businesses.


The Purpose of This Group is for You to:

1. Surround yourself in a positive business community, where you can network, meet other business owners and entrepreneurs, find new customers, strategic alliances/joint ventures, referral sources, investors, and make new friends.

2. Get the insider’s education: learn new skills and tools that will grow your business so you can thrive in any economy.

3. Share resources with other entrepreneurs and small business owners, so no one has to reinvent the wheel. It’s all about working smart, not hard---and leveraging your time and resources.


Your Organizer

My name is Dana Garrison and I’m your Organizer; I am an entrepreneur and small business owner, and I help business owners reach six figures and beyond. I'm also a business speaker and trainer, and speak on topics that help entrepreneurs and small business owners grow their business, their reach, and their profits.

I will also support you in growing your business, meeting new prospects, and creating new alliances with other entrepreneurs and small business owners.

And yes, I will help you love sales and marketing, and find ease and joy in it (and a high close ratio to boot!)


Our Community


Let's build this to be one of the largest business and entrepreneur meet up groups in NY, because the more entrepreneurs and small business owners we have, the larger network you have to grow your business.


The more business owners, entrepreneurs, and innovators you know, the more choices and possibilities you have.

 

The foundation of this group is to support each other in growing, and have fun along the way.


Help Spread the Word

I will market this group, and I would love if you would help spread the word about this group too, and send your business and entrepreneur friends this link: http://www.meetup.com/NY-Entrepreneur-and-Small-Business-MeetUp

 

We all succeed through community, so let’s get together and create win/wins.


Start Networking Now

After you click the join button, please introduce yourself. You can start networking right away!

And please fill out the 2 quick questions so we have a place to meet, and so I know what topics are most important for you, to help you grow your business.

 

Join now, and become part of the inner circle of movers and shakers.

results.description:
Haz amigos, involucrate, devuelve y conectate con tu comunidad!

Quienes somos

    Este grupo es principalmente para Mexicanos o México-Americanos  profesionales, estudiantes, empresarios y todos connacionales que buscan superarse y tiene un auténtico aprecio por la cultura mexicana.

    Se dirige principalmente a adultos de edades 21-45 que les gusta conocer a otros profesionales y socializar.

    Nuestro objetivo es conocer a otros profesionales que compartan nuestra cultura e idioma, apoyarse mutuamente y crear nuevas amistades!

    El idioma principal para nuestras comunicaciones es el español, aunque muchos de nuestros miembros hablan varios idiomas.

    Meetups se llevarán a cabo en restaurantes, bares, y posiblemente discotecas en el norte de Nueva Jersey y en la ciudad de Nueva York. Otros lugares se considerarán como vaya creciendo el grupo.

La mayoría de nuestros miembros tienen una licenciatura y muchos de ellos están estudiando grados avanzados.  Somos una mezcla diversa de profesionales.

    Invitamos a todo los profesionistas (incluyendo profesionales sin título), estudiantes universitarios y personas que estén por empezar la universidad para que nos apoyemos mutuamente.

    Es esencial que los integrantes puedan cómodamente contribuir y comunicarse con otros profesionales.  Esto nos ayuda a mantener un terreno común en el grupo.

Todos nuestr@s participantes deben:

    Participar y ser profesionales y cortés con los demás.

    Contestar todas las preguntas de perfil (más que "hola" por favor) e incluir una foto clara de sí mismo.

Confirmar Asistencia

    Si invita a un amigo o a su pareja, por favor incluyal@ en su RSVP. Algunos lugares podrían ser más pequeños y más íntimos que otros. Por lo tanto, si 10 de nosotros confirmamos nuestra  asistencia, entonces sólo 10 de nosotros deberíamos asistir ese día. Gracias por su comprensión, esto nos ayudará a planear mejor nuestros eventos.

    Para crear un grupo activo, si falta a tres Meetups a los cuales había confirmado su asistencia sin antes cambiar su RSVP, será expulsado del grupo.

    Preferimos calidad sobre cantidad. Los miembros que no han asistido a por lo menos una reunión en seis o más meses  serán eliminados. No es nada personal o permanente, antiguos miembros son bienvenidos para solicitar reincorporarse en cualquier momento.

Participación/publicidad

    Invitamos a todos nuestros miembros a que participen en nuestros foros.

    Por favor no publique propaganda  ya que esto será eliminado.

Como unirse al grupo

    Solo hace falta apretar el boton de "Join us" que aparece en la pagina nuestra de Meet-up y nos llegara su petición.

Únase a nuestro grupo,  esperamos conocerl@ pronto!

Make friends, get involved, give back and connect with your community!

Who we are

    This group is primarily for Mexican or Mexican-American professionals, students, entrepreneurs and all compatriots seeking to excel and have a true appreciation for  Mexican culture.

    It is primarily aimed at adults ages 21-45 who like to network and socialize.

    Our goal is to meet other professionals who share our culture and language, support each other and create new friendships!

    The main language used for our communications is Spanish, although many of our members are multi-lingual.

    Meetups will be held in restaurants, bars, and possibly nightclubs in northern NJ and NYC. Other venues will be considered as the group grows.

Most of our members have a bachelor’s degree and many of them are studying advanced degrees. We are a diverse mix of professionals.

    We invite all the professionals (including professionals without a degree), university students and people who are starting college to join to support each other.

    It is essential that members are able to contribute and communicate with other professionals. This helps us maintain a common ground in the group.

All our participants must:

    Participate and be professional and courteous to others.

    Answer all profile questions (more than "hello" please) and include a clear photo of yourself.

RSVP

    If you invite a friend or a significant other, please include them in your RSVP. Some venues might be smaller and more intimate than others.  Therefore, if 10 of us RSVP, then only the 10 of us should appear that day. Thanks for your understanding, this will helps us better plan our events.

    To foster an active group, three Meetups "no shows" will lead to your removal from the group.

    We prefer quality over quantity.  Members who have not attended a meetup in six months or more will be removed. It's nothing permanent or personal, former members are welcome to request rejoining at any time.

Group participation/advertisement

    We encourage group participation, so please feel free to post on our forums.

    Please do not post advertisements as these will be deleted.

How to join

    All you need to do is click on the “Join us”button on our Meetup page, and we will receive your request.

Join us, we look forward to meeting you!
results.name: Mexican Professionals NJ/NY

results.description:
he ultimate freedom is to have a completely clear and free mind. The human mind is always changing and is always trying to add more desirable experiences. There is no end to this addition. The way to find peace and clarity is to know the real world, the True world, by subtracting the past that has been recorded and stored within the body and mind as pictures.

There is nothing more valuable than one's mind. It shapes the entire world that one knows. Through subtracting method  the Universe mind will remain. This mind is always at peace regardless of conditions. It is the mind where there is no more ups and downs.

Become free of the limitations imposed by the past. These pictures dictate thoughts, emotions, desires, behaviors and health. Although these pictures are illusions, people unknowingly live within these illusions thinking they are real.

Bayside meditation is a non-profit organization that exists for the sole purpose of bringing people out of the mind world they are living in that includes stress, fear, anxiety, sadness, loneliness, resentment, anger, judgment, separation, boredom, purposelessness... all sorts of pain and burden.

The human mind is an accumulation of pictures of the past which create false limitations, habits, and a fixed, narrower mind. By subtracting the human mind with the subtraction method of meditation , people can remove the source of all disturbances. Even one's body will become healthier through practice since stress and other emotions cause so many health problems.

People live according to what they have in their minds. Through subtraction one's mind will change to the Universe mind and always follow the flow of nature. People will come to clearly know meaning and purpose in living.

Everyone from any background is warmly welcomed. Come to know Truth directly from within without any reference to what one has found or been told in the past. Thi meditation does not tell people to believe or not believe something, but through subtraction, they confirm for themselves. When the human mind changes to the Universe mind it is born again and never dies.

--- What People Say About the Meditation ---

"Throughout my entire life I always felt like there was something missing. So I kept adding more and became stressed, but this method of subtraction  was just the opposite. Instead of adding, the meditation provided a simple method of subtraction. After subtracting my past I began to change my mind; how I viewed the world. The method of subtraction allowed me to get rid of my 'self' and my self-centered mind which controlled my speech, thought, and action. Meditation with subtraction method allows me to live freely, without judgment and with gratitude." - Ben / Foster City, CA

"Meditation of subtraction method transcends the boundaries of all religions. It will elevate the human mind to the highest level of existence; the level of divinity. That is where peace is; the element that is meant to control the universe. Once we achieve a permanent peace, we can give it to others." -Dr. Charles Marcieca / International Association of Educators for World Peace. UN-NGO

"I have tried other forms of meditation in the past, but none stuck because they lacked the method of subtraction. Shortly after I started the meditation I found that I began to clear my mind and open my heart to a new Joyous feeling." -Clara / Santa Clara, CA

 

Come to a free introduction! Every Saturdays at 4pm (if this time is not possible you can schedule an individual introduction).

Please call for seating or if you have any questions: 516-644-5231

Or email: plainview@maum.org

We have guided sessions throughout the day 7 days a week, 365 days a year! Open from 8:30 am-10:30 pm everyday.

*There are Meditation centers with subtraction method all around the world. Other locations can be found at www.meditationusa.org

*Our official website

www.meditationusa.org

*Plainview Meditation official website

www.newyorkmeditation.org

*You can also find us through Facebook:

www.facebook.com/maumnorthamerica

Please Like us!!

results.description:
Ananda meditation groups are places of spiritual satsang for like-minded souls. Ananda NYC meets regularly for meditation, kirtan and satsang.   No prior meditation experience is required to join or attend.  All are welcome!

The purpose of this group is to help you experience the joy of meditation in a relaxed and supportive setting with sincere like-minded souls interested in meditating, learning, sharing, and connecting. This ancient healing science of meditation will help you reduce tension and feel more relaxed with improved mental clarity and awakened inner vitality. In addition to scientifically proven health benefits of meditation, these techniques can take you even deeper into an expanding connection with your spirit.

If you do not know how to meditate, we can teach you simple yet profound techniques.  If you already meditate we can help you learn how to meditate with more concentration and upliftment for those ready to take the next step on their spiritual journey.  In addition to a meditation, each meeting is unique with a different theme and will usually include: chanting, breath work (pranayama), spiritual reading and discussion, healing prayers... 

Everyone is welcome to join us. No prior experience is required. The group meets several times per month.  We have a fairly large distribution email list outside of MeetUp.  So typically many other members come to the events, but may not be RSVP'd on MeetUp.  We also host many workshops and events, check our website for the most updated schedule.

Our Roots:  Based on the teachings of Paramhansa Yogananda, and founded in 1968 by his direct disciple, Swami Kriyananda, Ananda meditation groups welcome seekers from all backgrounds.  We also offer support to those interested in the path of kriya yoga taught by Parmhansa Yogananda, author of the spiritual classic, Autobiography of a Yogi.

ॐ ॐ ॐ

Official Website: www.anandanewyork.org

facebook.com/AnandaNYC

results.description:
Divorce is one of the most emotionally difficult experiences you will face. We all need support, encouragement and something to look forward to as we go through these challenging times.  This group is designed to work with men and women considering divorce, in the midst of the process or post divorced who are seeking support and guidance to move forward.

In each session, you will find support and validation, be coached through your fears and guided to overcome your obstacles; and challenged to set new goals to begin to move forward. You will develop a community of friends who share your struggles and understand your pain and dreams.

We will be consistently inviting and encouraging you to embark on a journey of surviving, discovering, embracing, dreaming and living full out.

results.description:
.'Membership:
Membership is open to families with young children who live on Roosevelt Island. For safety and privacy reasons, new membership requests are not accepted until meeting with an organizer.

All members are required to host one meetup every three months (ie, once in Jan-Mar, once in Apr-Jun, Jul-Sept and once in Oct-Dec). Failure to meet this requirement will result in removal from the group.

2015 Membership Fee

The 2015 fee is $5 per family . The fee is non-refundable and non-transferable.

The membership fee pays for the Meetup website fees of $240/year. The membership fee does not cover the expenses of playdates. Event hosts may ask members to contribute supplies or a few dollars to cover costs of specific meetups.

Guest Policy
Members are not permitted to bring guests (aside from family members) to meetups unless it is clearly specified by the host. RSVPs should be limited to members and their family.

Advertising and Member Solicitation
Members are requested not to post meetups where they are directly profiting, growing a business, or networking.
Meetups should be limited to events which you are attending. Please do not add meetups solely for the sake of advertising.

Qualifying Meetups

Qualifying meetups mean organized playdates or activities (not open to other families not members of this group), with or without crafts, visits to any attraction, place, museum that your family enjoys.

An invite to the playroom in your building does not qualifies as a required meetup to keep your membership in this Meetup group.

Kim and Don

results.description:
Come out and meet new people in Northern New Jersey!

We will have a number of interesting meetups including museums, outdoor activities, festivals, picnics, movie nights, music, dancing, board games, trivia game nights, happy hours, and other social events. Have fun with our group at casual events which are inexpensive or free. Please join!

 

Group Guidelines:
Want to know where we are meeting or how to find us? If it's not included in the description, check the comments for the event. We post updates in the comments section where we are and how to spot us, if we've went to another place, if a place is difficult to find, and helpful directions.

Trouble with RSVPing? Please update your RSVP when possible, but when the day/time of the event is reached, the website closes it. Post in the comments if you are running late. For most of the events, there are no reservations (with a few exceptions) and anyone is welcome.

Have an idea for an event? Let us know because we love to try new things. Anyone active in our group can also create events and wait for people to RSVP. It’s fun! results.description:
Join us for Israeli Dancing ! It's a fun way to meet new friends and start a new hobby. It's a great way to be challenged mentally and physically. You don't have to be Jewish to do it. Move to beautiful middle eastern music!

A fun environment to learn Israeli dance, without the pressure of "Dating", or "Singles" meeting. It's easier and more natural to find a hobby & meet people who might have similar values and activities. There is less pressure and time to have fun, enjoy the music and a great way to meet new people!

We like to do a combination of the traditional Israeli folk dances and the new modern dances.

Please note that we currently have 10- 20 dancers dancing on a weekly basis - not just from the meetup groups.

If dancing is not for you, you can still come try it out and if prefer not to dance, you can just enjoy watching and be social.  We serve light kosher refreshments

There is no age restriction. We have young dancers in their 20's and older dancers in their 40's, 50's, 60's, and even 70's!

Anyone who wants some exercise can join. No prior experience necessary. We are currently meeting in Connecticut -  New Haven County (New Haven), Fairfield County (Stamford)

New York - Westchester County (Yorktown Heights), Rockland County (Nyack), Kings (Brooklyn)  See my separate meetup group for Brooklyn Israeli Dancers.  

** I am now starting to include Internation Folk Dance at some of my sessions **  Please let me know if you are particularly interested in International Folk Dancing !

Please encourage your friends to join this group if they are interested in Israeli or International Folk Dancing !

results.description:
This is the meet up group for the SharePoint User Group in NYC that meets at Microsoft Manhattan on the first Wednesday of the month.

The NYC SharePoint Users Group (NYCSPUG) was founded in March 2006. Our mission from inception has been to share deep SharePoint experience with individuals who are interested in learning, sharing and growing their Microsoft SharePoint knowledge and capabilities. The group’s vision is to provide members with a forum to hear top industry experts present, learn and teach others who are interested in the same technologies as you and are facing the same challenges. The NYC SharePoint Users Group covers the entire spectrum of SharePoint technologies, including the SharePoint Portal Server, Windows SharePoint Services, development with Visual Studio.NET and the .NET Framework (including web parts, web services, and object model applications.)


The user group would like to thank all members for their continued support and contribution, and would especially like to thank the following for their dedication in keeping the user group running:

Founders:

Former Chairperson: Dave Kozma

Chairperson: Nilesh Mehta (NGenious Solutions Inc.)


NGenious Solutions, Inc. is a Microsoft Certified Gold Partner specializing in Information Worker and ISV ⁄ Software Solutions. We believe that Microsoft Office Solutions provide organizations with opportunities to achieve excellent improvements in productivity, especially the SharePoint and Enterprise Project Management Technologies. Our complete range of services, addresses the needs of both technology and business requirements to help organizations leverage leading–edge technologies for business improvement. NGenious Solutions Inc.’s engineers, business analysts and architects are seasoned industry veterans with extensive experience working with enterprise IT systems. Our experts can interact efficiently with remote IT organizations and can act as a seamless extension of headquarters IT management.

The NYC SharePoint User Group Team

Meeting Management:

Nilesh Mehta, (NGenious Solutions Inc.) Chair

Andres Cano, (NGenious Solutions Inc.)

results.description: We are a non-profit group of bold, quirky tipsters who give advice for 25 cents in public places in the city. The way it works is we sit on fold-able chairs in the square, and we give you advice anytime you drop us a quarter and ask us a question. Any kind of advice. And yes, to anyone. We are just as qualified to do this as you are. The quarters? We use them to organize and grow this group, as well as build our website. Why do we do all this? Because we love making people happy, talking to anyone in our city, offering our view points, giving our outside opinion, and hearing all the stories. We do this because every once in awhile we provide direction to those who truly need it. And of course you can always get your quarter back. results.description:
Meet other local fans of Ayn Rand and her philosophy Objectivism—a philosophy of Reason, Purpose, and Self-Esteem that holds human life on this Earth as the standard of all values and your life as an end in itself instead of a means to the ends of others.

You are invited, if you are a rational person who:

  • values reason, integrity, independence, and productive work;
  • holds that no one may initiate the use of force against others and a proper government is necessary to secure it;
  • deals with others as traders who honestly and voluntarily (and thus mutually) seek their own benefits;
  • regards one's own rational self-interest as the highest moral purpose of life, with no obligation or morality to sacrifice oneself to others or sacrifice others to oneself.

The goal of this meetup is to help local Objectivists:

  • socialize and expand their friend networks;
  • become more successful and productive;
  • enjoy life, be happy, and remain healthy;
  • improve the general culture in which we have to live and the free country which we love.

We meet at least monthly for various activities—lectures, discussions, trying new restaurants, enjoying arts and museums, outdoors, etc, and the format is usually casual, intellectual, and always civil and rational.

If you are not yet familiar with Objectivism but are interested in learning more about Ayn Rand's ideas, about laissez-faire capitalism, about the free society, about happiness and self-improvement, or about morality and philosophy in general, you are also welcome and will find many intelligent, fun, and friendly Objectivists to talk to.
results.name: New York Objectivists

results.description:
REAL is eating where the international communities of New York eat when they want a taste of home.

REAL is eating what they eat.

REAL is taking your senses on an adventure around the globe without leaving New York City.

REAL is supporting small restaurants.  All bills will be paid the old-fashioned way, cash only.

REAL is being yourself. Talk about food. Talk about work. Talk about love. Talk about the world. Talk about anything. Just keep it real. But don't forget to laugh your ass off.

REAL is not a Fear Factor challenge. We will not be eating spicy frog buttocks or mad cow brains tartare. Unless it's delicious, of course.

The Organizer will research the cuisine and, whenever possible, taste test the restaurant and select dishes that highlight a variety of cooking techniques and authentic flavors. Beware - spicy foods will be spicy.

Everyone has their kryptonite, but you are responsible for your own dietary restrictions, allergies, health and general welfare. Dinners will be family-style; everyone will pay an equal share of the final food bill. You will be responsible for paying for your own drinks and individual desserts.

Each dinner will be limited to one table. Please honor your RSVP. Stuff happens. Same day cancellations are acceptable, but abusers of the RSVP process will be dealt with severely or at least removed from the group.

An open mind with a robust sense of humor is appreciated, but please be respectful and courteous. Everyone is welcome once, but not everyone is welcome twice. Behave now.

GET REAL. YOU KNOW YOU WANT TO.

results.description: I started this club To give mountain Bikers a place to meet and ride off road in a noncompetitive atmosphere.  I set up this site to allow members to post rides themselves, to meet with other Stone Age members, to all ride together.  Their are a few required rules to posting rides on this site, as the founder and organizer, I set these guidelines to keep people safe and informed, as well as to make sure the rides follow the basic philosophies that the club was originally set up to promote. As Organizer, I reserve the right to cancel any ride that has been posted, if I feel it is not safe or follow the basic philosophies of the club.  In order to post rides, First you have to have been on a ride already with me.  If you have never been on one of our rides, you simply will not be able to post a ride of your own. You need to have the noncompetitive philosophy and just be riding for the fun of it, whether fast or slow.  When posting a ride, in addition to your own info, the description of the ride should contain length of ride in time and difficulty level in a 1 - 10 format where 10 is the most difficult.  If info is not known about the area or trails,  the ride should be announced as an "exploration" ride and everyone who shows up must be ready for whatever comes along.   As a rule, It is important to remember that all riders are responsible for there own well being.  Stone Age MTB and Meetup.com is in no way responsible for the safety of you or your equipment.  Although we ride as a group,   everyone is an individual and is 100% responsible for themselves.  As a group someone will always be there to help and advise, but be prepared with what ever you think you might need to bring on the rides. All our rides require the basics.  A helmet, water and a functioning mountain bike, that means brakes that stop and gears that shift.  A hybrid bike or other types of bikes would not be advised as your safety and the safety of other members would be compromised.  There will always be someone with tools and supplies to help out if needed, but it is important to show up with a bicycle that has been checked out and functional.  The meetup spot is not the time to check your bike to see if its ok.  Although our group is not going to be scheduling many novice rides any longer,  There will be instead a series of "Bike Rodeos" that myself and other members will be doing to help new comers get acquainted with Mountain biking in a safe fun way.  There will be a few rodeos throughout the year.  The  name Stone Age Mountain Bikers was chosen because the club is geared towards men and women over 40. This is not a rule, only a guideline. Young riders and racers already have enough ways to meet and ride together. We need a place as well.  When I started Mountain Biking in 1984, after a pathetic stint road racing. I wish I had someone who was willing to take there time and knowledge to teach me basic techniques and to help and encourage me. I learned  training for and racing NORBA races and riding all the original trails on rigid bikes.  Become a Stone Age Mountain Biker, get started riding with people who ride like you.
results.name: Stone Age Mountain Bikers

results.description:
Basecamp + Brooklyn (where I am based) = BaseKamp.  However, this group is for all NYC, Tri-state & beyond mountain freaks interested in the following:

1. Peakbagging the 4,000 footers in New England and in New York: NE115 (The Northeast 115 4k's), NH48, ADK46, and to a slightly lesser extent NEHH (New England Highest Hundred) & Catskill 35.

2. Speed or ultra hiking long distance trails, e.g., the Presidential & Great Range traverses, White Mountain Hut-to-Hut, Devil's Path, Long Path, Long Trail, NPT (The Northville-Lake Placid TR), AT, PCT, etc., as well as backpacking them.

3. Mountaineering and technical climbing.

4. Exploratory outings such as caving and spelunking.

This group is set up so that any member can post events, and we are a peer group in the fairest sense.  Everyone carries their own weight, and can lead as well as participate in an event.  As a member, you are encouraged to lead at least one event every quarter (Spring, Summer, Fall, Winter) or four times a year.

We have a strict attendance policy, and zero tolerance for any inappropriate behavior, which makes our group a safe haven for considerate, like-minded, smart and self-reliant adventurists in two boots.

Please read our group policy before joining: http://www.meetup.com/BASEKAMP/pages/Group_policy

By joining, you have agreed to: http://www.meetup.com/BASEKAMP/about/

If you are a cyclist and interested in cycling adventures, please join our sister group: http://www.meetup.com/Bike-to-Adventure/
results.name: BaseKamp

results.description:
What is this group about?

The name says it all. Gather with the girls and enjoy a vegan lunch and a little conversation. Think "girls night out" only daytime and without the crowded dance floor. Now, a hangover is still very much a possibility. On occasion, members may gather to volunteer at a shelter, take a field trip to a rescue farm, or do a little Vegan Shopping.

Who can join this group? 

Currently our members range from ages mid 20's to mid 40's. We are students, business women, and moms. If you do not fall within this age group you are still welcome to send a request to join as we hope to expand our age range in the near future.

How can I Join this group? 

Just complete the membership form via meetup. Allow at least one week for someone to get back to you. Please note: if you do not have a photo of your face in your profile, we will not be able to approve your membership request. We gets lots of requests with random works of art, dogs, flowers, logos- but this group is about making human connections. If your request is declined you can always change your photo and resubmit.

When do you meet?

VLWL (NYC) meet at least once a month on the second weekend of the month. We alternate between Saturdays and Sundays. Most meetings are "brunch" themed, but there are the occasional evening events.

How do you determine where we will go?

Currently any member may suggest a vegan outing. To suggest an event please click on "Our Calendar", then click on "Suggested". One of the group organizers will then look at your suggestion and determine when it will fit into our schedule. When suggestiothe menu is not 100% Vegan it must have at least 4 Vegan options on the menu. When suggesting a restaurant, take a look at whether there are any Raw or Gluten Free options on the menu. We have several members who have dietary restrictions and try to include everyone.

Is this free?

It is free to join, but most events require some fee for dining.

 

Looking forward to meeting up!

- Your friends at Vegan Ladies Who Lunch
results.name: Vegan Ladies Who Lunch (NYC)

results.description:
Prometheus is the ancient Athenian (Greek) god of technology and a divine rebel.

The Shrine of Prometheus is a group of Pagans, polytheists, occultists, and others who revere Prometheus, either as an actual deity or as a symbol, or who have a strong interest in science and technology. We also welcome anyone with an interest in how science and technology relate to spirituality. Our aims include:

1) To educate ourselves and other polytheists and occultists about a variety of topics pertaining to science/technology and spirituality.

2) To foster a sense of community among polytheists and occultists with a strong interest in science and technology, whether professional or amateur, and to facilitate professional networking among polytheists and occultists who work in technical fields.

3) To develop rituals and other activities to honor Prometheus and to foster our own technological creativity and problem-solving ability.

For now, we'll hold informal discussion meetings of our own, plus occasional trips to museums and to relevant events held by other organizations. Later, when we have enough regularly-attending members, we'll also hold more structured events of our own, including rituals.

For more information, please see our "About" page:  http://www.meetup.com/New-York-City-Shrine-of-Prometheus/about/ .
results.name: NYC Shrine of Prometheus

results.description: This Meetup is designed to help people enrich their social relationships, increase creativity, enhance spontaneity, and meet new friends. This is not a superficial singles discussion; it’s an exclusive social experience based on the concepts of Fromm, Maslow, Reich, Ellis, and other greats in humanistic philosophy and psychology. The philosopher Martin Buber said that life is an encounter with oneself, others and nature, but we need to have these encounters enhance warmth, mutual understanding and health. In this new series of Meet-ups, on the third Friday of each month, we will explore all the many aspects of interaction and relationships that ultimately make our lives more gratifying and effective. With guidance from an experienced group moderator, participants will create an experiential dialogue of sharing and learning, followed by relaxed socializing and light refreshments. The Humanist Inspirational Meetup is based on many years of highly successful development at the Humanist Foundation; its leader and counselor Joseph B. David has professionally conducted hundreds of humanist growth workshops and seminars. The hectic pace and complexities of today’s life make this program a welcome setting for meeting like-minded people and exploring ideas together.
results.name: Humanistic Interpersonal Meetup

results.description:
Let's be honest, it's hard being a single mother. It's even more difficult being a single mother to special needs kids. 'NYC Single Mothers with Special Needs Children' is a group dedicated to bring together moms who are single and raising special needs children alone for whatever the reason may be. Even if you are a mom who isn't single but feels there is a lack of family support, this is the place for you.

This group is not exclusive, it is just a group to help us find each other among all of the single parents groups, and parents with special needs groups. We have a specific situation and it is beneficial to meet others in the same boat. This group is for support, sharing information, and you and your child(ren)'s stories. Meet ups will be difficult I know, but we will make them happen.

results.description:
Members and friends of the Raritan Valley Road Runners, also known as RVRR, the best running club in NJ!

We run at 6:30 PM every Wednesday night. Wednesday night runs are what have sustained the club since 1983 - we have never missed a Wednesday night run due to weather, holidays, or any other distracting event! Right now our runs depart from Grove 5, Johnson Park. We also hold Saturday AM runs from Grove 5, Johnson Park onto the Towpath, currently these runs begin at 8am. We also hold various other runs and events and participate in USATF-NJ races as a team (all paces welcome!), so please ask anyone about these other opportunities if interested!

The best way to check us out is to come to a club run, however after 2 runs, we please ask you to join the club for the low low price of $23/year. Visit our website for our membership application & fee information: Join RVRR today! Here is how... and for other details: http://rvrr.org/

If you're looking for RVRR singlets they are available at Runner's High in Metuchen.... other RVRR gear is available through our website:http://www.rvrr.org/store/

Also follow us on twitter: @RVRoadRunners

results.description:
Zentangle® is an easy to learn, relaxing way to create beautiful pieces of art using the "Anything is Possible, One Stroke at a Time"® method. This group is open to those interested in learning about this fascinating, meditative style and those already practicing it as a Life Skill.  I am a Certified Zentangle Teacher (CZT) and have been teaching Zentangle workshops here on Long Island since 2009.  In addition to my own workshops, I am a teacher at the Art League of Long Island.  You can get details for my workshops held there at www.artleagueli.org  

I hope we will be meeting in a variety of locations,days and times and sharing our passion for this unique art form.  Using focus and repetitive patterns, we'll be making small pieces of art using beautiful handmade paper and pigment ink pens.  There will be a wide variety of classes from introductory to Zendalas, Illuminated letters, journaling, and even developing our own tangles (patterns).

If you are interested, let me know what days and times work best for you and I'll do my best to set something up that will work for you.  You may bring friends, but they must be registered (if they are with you, they do not have to be a member of this MeetUp group).

And finally, if you want to host a Zentangle class for your friends and family in your own home or at your workplace, I can discuss details with you in a private message or phone call.
results.name: Zentangle® Long Island, New York

results.description: We are the Greater New York Independent Publishers Association (“GNYIPA”), a small, select professional level group of people involve with book publishing, writing, book design, book promotion, and self publishing. Our published works comprise a wide range of subjects and genres, including: non-fiction, fiction, self-help, history, LGBT literature, art, photography, playwrights, memoirs, children’s books, and other genres. You do not need to be a published author to join GNYIPA, but you need to have as professional attitude about yourself and your work. GYUIPA meetings are not the place to hustle your work, tell us all of your opinions, and be disruptive. We are looking for people to join GNYIPA who can be an asset the group, who value working with a group, and who have time and energy to give to our projects such as readings, book fairs and events, etc. What we can offer you is real support in the extremely difficult environment of publishing today. If you feel that this kind of group is for you, then we will welcome you as a guest to your first meeting. To attend a second meeting, you will have to be invited to join, after filling out a membership form. Be advised: we are a working group of professionals in the book world, so our meetings deal with professionalism and how to maintain it. They are not simply entertainment. Potential authors who are progressing on their manuscripts and are considering self-publishing their work are welcome to attend.  We meet on the first Wednesday of each month at a midtown location. To find out the location, you need to be invited by the organizer of this group.
results.name: The Greater New York Independent Publishers Association

Our group is limited to men 18 years of age and older. Our focus is men who live in the NYC tri-state area, though we men from other areas are welcome to join, especially if travel brings you to NYC.

This is a private group and only members can access other members profiles. See below for how to adjust your privacy settings.

Whether you go for strictly therapeutic massage and platonic bodywork, energy healing, cuddling, gourmet hugs, or a juicier sensual massage, erotic massage, or massage exchange combined with gay sex, the group is set up to support you in finding friendly men to exchange with, and to assist those who like to organize small groups.

Periodically we alert members to events and resources on related topics including male massage, enhancing intimacy, sexual healing and meaningful emotional connection and relationship, and other topics of interest to the group.

You must have a complete profile filled out to be approved to join this group. Please insure your location on your member profile (next to your name) is correct.

The word massage as used in this group refers to informal, caring bodywork and touch of the kind that friends share together. It does not refer to any form of professional massage therapy.

While those in this group may exchange bodywork and share ideas & techniques, participating in this group will not provide therapeutic massage, massage instruction, diagnosis or medical advice. Consult a licensed massage therapist, massage school, doctor or other health care practitioner for these purposes. Any fees charged for meetings are for the use of meeting space, for supplies, promotional costs, and for the facilitation of meetings, educational personal growth exercises and men's group dynamics. Therapeutic massage and instruction in therapeutic massage is not provided by this group.

Tell your friends about the NYC male massage, NYC m4m massage and NYC gay massage opportunities with us!

http://www.meetup.com/NYCMaleMassage

Other groups that may interest you:

Boston Men's Massage Exchange

NYC Men's Massage Exchange

Philadelphia Men's Massage Exchange

Washington DC Area Men's Massage Exchange

Greater Orlando Men's Massage Exchange

Vancouver Men's Massage Exchange

How to update your Meetup privacy settings

Before joining you may wish to update the privacy settings on your Meetup account.

Here's how:

1.If desired, hide the list of Meetup groups you belong to

Here's how

2. If desired, remove your last name from your Meetup account:

When logged into Meetup, Click "Account Settings" (upper left of screen)

Click "General" in the dropdown menu

Click the "edit" link by your name

Update and click submit

More detailed directions here

This is a private group.  You can review more detailed information about Meetup privacy here

Photo Policy

In the spirit of creating community, we encourage but do not require members to share a headshot (face) photo that shows your eyes on your group profile. If you adjust your privacy settings as above this should n

In keeping with Meetup.com Terms of Service, we are unable to allow nude photos ("unclothed persons") whether the image is artistic or not.

VentureOutNY is focused on helping to enable international startups to launch and succeed in New York City. Based on the philosophy that talent is evenly distributed but opportunity is not, VentureOutNY’s mission is to bridge that gap between the entrepreneurial talent abroad to the vast opportunities in burgeoning technology community in New York.

Through regionally focused events, VentureOutNY introduce the world’s most talented international entrepreneurs to the startup ecosystem in NYC, fast tracking their growth by helping establish relationships with the most relevant investors, entrepreneurs and partners in New York City.

VentureOutNY was founded by Brian Frumberg in 2011 with the help of partner Jennifer Charlton, Community & Communications Manager for the Consulate of Switzerland.

BFS members have a wide range of professional backgrounds in publicity, design and media, finance, the arts, hotels, hospitality and more. The common thread of this diverse group: members really want to make a difference. You can too.

There are many opportunities to get involved:

You can make a difference. Join us today! For more information about the Brighter Futures Society, contact Alyssa Franklin at 212-273-6551 or alyssa.franklin@yai.org.

results.description:
Welcome to Sundance Outdoor Adventure Society!
Founded in 1980, Sundance Outdoor Adventure Society is a not-for-profit, community-based organization for LGBT people in the NY-NJ-CT tri-state region who enjoy participating in non-competitive outdoor activities. The purpose of the club is to organize various outdoor and cultural activities and to enjoy the great outdoors with each other!

Learn about Sundance through photos and articles in our newsletter:

Go to 'More' and click on 'Files' to see recent issues of the "Crosswinds", the Sundance newsletter.

Our Mission Statement

  • To provide non-competitive outdoor activities for the enjoyment of GLBT people.
  • To foster the meeting of like-minded people and encourage a sense of community.
  • To encourage an appreciation and respect for the natural world.
  • We're a  fun, inclusive and friendly club that's been around since 1980! Everyone is welcome.
  • There are well over 100 outings organized each year. Some examples of outings are:
  • Hiking in the Catskills
  • Bike riding in the Hamptons
  • Paddling the Hackensack on an Ecotour
  • Visiting the Museum of Modern Art
  • Cross-country Skiing in Vermont
  • Backpacking in the Adirondacks
  • Canoeing in Canada
  • Camping at an LGBT Campground
What are some special advantages that Sundance offers over other venues?
  • We’re an all-volunteer organization. No one gets paid for anything they do in Sundance.
  • We offer lots of outings, in great variety - There are events for all levels - easy to advanced.
  • We’re a full service organization: Leaders are well organized and plan everything for their outing, from recommending equipment to helping to arrange carpools, to planning the trip.
  • Sundance can front any deposits needed by outing leaders (e.g. for outfitter costs).
  • Camaraderie of a club: Over time, as you attend more outings, you’ll meet and get to know members. Many members have formed life-long friendships in our club.
  • Consistency and reliability of the outings: All outing submissions go through a review process and are vetted by Team Captains and our Outings Director.
  • We have a lot of experience in handling unforeseen events that come up on outings (these are documented in our member/ leadership handbook.)
  • The club funds leadership safety training courses for leaders each year.
  • Sundance is incorporated with the State of New York. As a result, we adhere to NYS’ laws governing not-for-profit corporations, such as holding elections and maintaining financial records, and maintaining a fully staffed Board of Directors.
results.name: Sundance Outdoor Adventure Society

I’m starting this group to gauge interest in Tarot Classes offered in the Wall Street area. I will be using TRS Professional Suites at 40 Exchange Place as the classroom venue. Please join this group if you live or work in an area that is convenient to Wall Street and you would like to take Tarot classes at TRS. The evenings I will offer classes will be Tuesday, Thursday, or Friday. Class cost will be $17 in advance or $20 at the door for a two-hour class.

Whether you are a Tarot newbie, or already have knowledge of Tarot, you can learn techniques of interpretation that you can apply to any spread or use with your favorite Tarot deck. Rather than learning spreads or memorizing standard card meanings, you will learn techniques of interpretation that will allow the cards to speak to you and allow your own intuition to guide you to the truth.

The class works best for students who bring a Rider Waite, Universal Waite, or other versions of the Waite deck to class, but they are also encouraged to bring other decks as many of the interpretive techniques are transferable.
results.name: New York Intuitive Tarot Classes – Wall Street Edition

Welcome to the NYC Private and Hybrid Cloud User Group! We are here to bring together developers, architects, sysadmins, devops people, enterprises, start-ups... basically anyone interested in various possibilities of private and hybrid cloud solutions.

Private clouds give users immediate access to computing resources hosted within an organization's infrastructure. Users self-provision and scale collections of resources drawn from the private cloud, typically via web service interface, just as with a public cloud.

A hybrid cloud combines computing resources (e.g., machines, network, storage, etc.) drawn from one or more public clouds and one or more private clouds at the behest of its users.

results.description:
This group was originally formed to make its way through the book "Seven Languages in Seven Weeks: A Pragmatic Guide to Learning Programming Languages," by Bruce Tate. The book is a quick deep-dive into seven very different languages: Ruby, Io, Prolog, Scala, Erlang, Clojure and Haskell.

We found we enjoyed hearing about a new language every month, so much that we decided to continue the group after the end of the book. It seemed that there was a place for a group that gives programmer-level (but not too scary!) introductions to languages that members have always heard about but haven't ever delved into. Some languages are too obscure to have their own Meetup groups, but even for the ones that aren't, sometimes you want an overview of the key features of a language and what makes it special, which you might not always get at a Meetup devoted to that language, among people who are already familiar with it.

As of this writing, we've had talks on (in addition to the languages listed above) Python, OCaml, Go, JavaScript, Smalltalk, J, and Perl. If you've got a language you'd like to hear on intro on, join the group and make a suggestion!

We have an IRC channel on Freenode (#nlang). Come join and hang out if you want to connect.
results.name: N Languages in N Months NYC

results.description: This two-session workshop will focus on building a strong, complete short story for each participant. Participants will become acquainted with the logistics of writing a short story, and will learn how to accurately express a creative vision through their words. This workshop is intended to provide an enriching and valuable learning experience for both new and experienced writers. As a group, we will analyze and provide feedback on each others’ work through the workshop format, with participation and constructive feedback contributing to our creative growth.

results.description:
We are a community of foragers and friends gathering together and learning from each other in NY and NJ.

Mission
Our mission is to gather together as a community and have fun teaching, learning and practicing sustainable living through our wilderness adventures in our backyards and beyond.

Our Motto is "Gather Together".

We are fun, friendly, local, outdoors, sustainable, organic, wild, educational, teaching, healthy, healing, laughing, smiling, eating, creative, playful, nutritious and delicious. Gathering together with us is good for your soul ♥.

We offer memorable experiences of great food, fresh air and good company.

We schedule wild edibles walks and workshops on plant identification, harvesting, preparation, preservation, cooking, medicinal uses and dyes. We also schedule wilderness adventure workshops on primitive survival skills, such as emergency shelter building, fire making, trapping, cordage making, water purification, and hide tanning.

Our community of friends include foragers, mycologists, herbalists, hunters, anglers, permies, healers, farmers, foodies, survivalists, wild crafters, locavores, families, dreamers and more.

Check out our website and like our Facebook page for events and blogs about sustainable living.

http://www.suburbanforagers.com

www.facebook.com/SuburbanForagers

 

We are an *active* group and expect all of our members to be active participants. While we do not limit our membership, our focus is quality, not quantity. If members are not active, they may be removed from the group.  Please also post a real photo of yourself so that we know you are not a lurker.

Thank you for your interest. We look forward to meeting you soon.
results.name: Suburban Foragers of NY and NJ

results.description:
Thyroid disease, whether it's Grave's, Hashish's, Hyper, Hypo, or Cancer, is life altering diagnosis. Survivors are often under treated by their physicians or still struggling to find their way through a maze of information. It can be a emotional and lonely experience that is misunderstood by others. This group is for anyone looking to connect with others about their experiences, to learn from each other about what has worked (or not), and find overall support. Perhaps you or someone you know has been diagnosed. Or perhaps you would want to simply learn about the thyroid and how to maintain its health. We'll also share some tid bits on how to stay healthy and protect this vital organ! I look forward to meeting everyone, sharing stories, struggles, and creating a community where we are reminded we are not alone.

(P.S. Blue "Butterflies" represent and is a symbol for the thyroid as it is similarly shaped)
results.name: Thyroid Wellness & Support - NYC

The Afterburn was created to encourage people to live their life powerfully through life changing experiences.

For what it's worth: it's never too late or, in my case, too early to be whoever you want to be. There's no time limit, stop whenever you want. You can change or stay the same, there are no rules to this thing. We can make the best or the worst of it. I hope you make the best of it. And I hope you see things that startle you. I hope you feel things you never felt before. I hope you meet people with a different point of view. I hope you live a life you're proud of. If you find that you're not, I hope you have the strength to start all over again. -The Curious Case of Benjamin Button

topics.name: Internet Marketing Strategies For Business Owners

results.description:
OUR MEETUPS ARE FREE, AND THERE WILL BE NO SALES OR PITCHING! ONLY INFORMATIVE AND CONTENT PACKED MEETINGS :-)

You probably realize your business needs some form of Internet  and/or Social Media Marketing, but no one can seem to explain to you how it all  works in plain English...  Or if you are an Entrepreneur and just want to learn how to build a BLOG – come to the Meetups and we'll all help each other figure it out. Even if you’re an experienced Internet Marketer, come and join the meetings so we can all trade useful tips and information.

We will trade information and tips on how "non-techy" small business owners & entrepreneurs can successfully use various methods of internet marketing to expand their businesses & access thousands of new clients at once.

Come to this Meetup if some of the questions below apply to you:

  • What is Internet Marketing / Social Media, and how is it used by businesses and Entrepreneurs?
  • Don't know where to start ...this is a good place to begin
  • Already have a website but feel it's not being used effectively as a business building tool?  Find out why, and how you can make it more effective by applying Internet Marketing, and Social Media, principles.
  • Unsure what exactly your web designer / marketer does with all the money you're paying them? Once you understand the basic concepts of Internet Marketing, you’ll be able to tell them exactly what you want done, but best of all – you’ll be able to do it yourself!
  • Are you ready to dominate your market in this competitive economy?  Now is the perfect time to do it, because very few small businesses are using Internet Marketing to their advantage.   Learn how to do get ahead from those who have done it, and are going it right now!

SOME OF THE TOPICS WE WILL DISCUSS

  1. Creating your Brand on the Internet
  2. Getting on Google: what is "Search Engine Optimization" (SEO) and how do I do it myself?
  3. How to get a top rankings on SEOs, so “all roads” lead to your website
  4. Social Media: What's Twitter, and how is it used for Internet Marketing & by businesses
  5. Social Media: What's Facebook, and how is it used for Internet Marketing & by businesses
  6. Social Media: What's LinkedIn, and how is it used for Internet Marketing & by businesses
  7. Social Media: What's YouTube, and how is it used for Internet Marketing & by businesses
  8. Social Media: What's Pinterest, and how is it used for Internet Marketing & by businesses
  9. Building a “Buyer/Seller List” with your website, and how do you use it in Interent Marketing
  10. Doing promotional launches and e-mail marketing campaigns
  11. Bring your own topic and questions you'd like to discuss

…and many more...
results.name: Internet and Social Media Marketers Group

results.description:
Welcome to the OTD* Meetup!

We are a group of individuals from formerly Orthodox Jewish backgrounds who meet on a regular basis for good food, thoughtful conversation, and for making new friends. Most of us were raised with strong attachments to Jewish observance, but--while we are each on our own journey--now live mostly secular lives. Our past unites us, and we take from it what we still find meaningful, but we otherwise live simply as members of the world community.

We are always eager to meet new people who have an interest in the OTD Community, whether formerly Orthodox or not, so feel free to join this group even if you're not sure you're a perfect fit. We're a friendly bunch, and appreciate people from all backgrounds.

At this time, we try to organize at least two events per month, one in NYC and one in Rockland-Bergen County. Events include but are not limited to: dining out, pot-luck dinners, meeting for a movie, attending musical performances and other cultural events, or anything else our members are interested in. We're always looking for new experiences, so suggestions are welcome and encouraged. At this time, most of our meetups take place during weekends.

We hope you will join us. If you have questions, please drop us a note by clicking the "Contact" button to the left.

Please note: while there is no fee to join our group, we ask that you contribute $1 per event (for events you choose to attend) in order to cover the meetup.com admin fee.

You must be a minimum of eighteen years of age to join our meetup events. Most events are adults-only. Some events are kids-friendly. Unless explicitly specified, event are adults-only.

(*OTD stands for "Off the Derekh"--or off the path of Orthodox observance.)


Screening process to protect group members identity:
-All group members can attend events taking place on Shabbat.
-Only “vouched” group members can attend events taking place on weekdays/weeknights.

How to become a “vouched” member (only one of the three options required):
1) A current “vouched” group member vouches for you.
---> or
2) Attend a Shabbat meetup event.
---> or
3) Meet in person with an organizer or an assigned vouched group member.

OTDM was founded in loving memory of a beloved friend
Rachel Nove
6/13/1980 - 1/28/2010
results.name: OTD Meetup: Social Events in New York City & Rockland-Bergen

results.description: Ever since I became a survivor twelve years ago after I found my mother when she committed suicide, I've wanted to find and spend time with others who can identify with the ways this tragic event has changed and shaped my life. Grief counseling groups were helpful for me in the early stages of my personal griefing process, but now that I've found peace with being a survivor I'd like to work to bring some of us together to be able to appreciate the people we've become and how we've changed from our personal experience with suicide. For me, this group is for survivors who are interested in a survivor social group to spend time with (coffee, drinks, movies, hiking, etc) as opposed to a pure grief counseling/support group. If the event is still very raw and/or recent for you, then I don't believe that this social group would be the group for you. There is an excellent support/griefing group that I've attended in NYC and you can get more information here: http://www.samaritansnyc.org/safeplace.html
results.name: Survivors of Suicide Social Gathering Group

results.description:
Filmmaking became accessible for virtually everyone. Shooting on film is beautiful and as a Director/Writer I love it but I've seen remarkable Motion Pictures shot on cell phones and full frame digital cameras. There are many ways to make it in the Film Industry: Write a screenplay - hand it to an agent; make a short - send it to a festival; go to film school - make commercials/music videos; the key is MEET PEOPLE, WORK HARD TOGETHER, BE TENACIOUS and make films - don't talk about making them and what you would need and what you don't have etc. This group is for motivated creatives who want to make independent movies and built a network. We'll set meeting places to discuss projects. If we fall in love with a project we'll see if we can get funding and who can work on production. We'll pretty much scratch each other's backs and work on projects that we respect and earn respect for individual projects. There are lots of screenplays and ideas out there that haven't been made into a movie for one simple reason: THEY ARE EXPECTED NOT TO BE PROFITABLE. But studios have to deal with the union and permits and bunch of other things that swallow money. Independent Film does not.

And that's where Film Fast Forward comes in.

Come to Zensual Yoga and practice yoga in the buff! Both the Zensual Yoga and Zensual Dance classes have live musicians playing. The yoga class is a combination of Vinyasa and Kudalini Yoga and includes a meditation at the end of class.

Zensuality also offers NYC’s only Drum and Dance Circles that are clothing optional during which you can dance naked around an indoor fire pit! This drum circle is offered monthly and is not too be missed!

Our Zensual Meditations are also nude and clothing optional. In our Zensual Kitchen class you will learn to prepare yummy, healthy vegetarian and raw food meal and aphrodisiacs that will increase your sexual energy as well as nourish your body mind and soul.

Look out for our Zensuality Outdoors’ trips to nude beaches as well as resorts that embrace naturism and sensuality.
