results.description:
Westchester Families is for all families with children, from infant to 18 years old living in Westchester County, New York. Westchester Families embraces the diversity of all its members and is proud to be the 'Ultimate MeetUp Group,' catering to the interests of all family members.

Co-organizers Laura and Elisabeth have hosted or recommended hundreds of events during the past two-years. We have been working very hard since the beginning on creating a valuable and trusted resource that offers something for everyone.

Westchester Families combines many of the interests and hobbies tailored for the greater Westchester area. As so many meetup groups are geared towards hosting events primarily for children, Westchester Families takes it to the next level and hosts events for both the children and the adults.

Westchester Families will post as many events, activities, workshops, fairs, exhibits and more as we find them. We welcome members to contact us with their interests and suggestions. We have built strong relationships with local business owners, allowing Westchester Families to offer activities such as free trial classes along with charity events and local happenings.

Hope you decide to join our community, Westchester Families, and begin the adventure!
results.name: Westchester Families

results.description:
This is an IBM sponsored Big Data meetup group.  Geared towards developers, data scientists and all Big Data enthusiasts, our meetups provide an opportunity to work hands on with the solutions and tools in our Big Data platform.

Our Meetups typically include a 45-60 min (max) presentation that serves as an introduction and overview for a specific Big Data technology.  It is followed by ~3 hours to collaborate with fellow developers and apply your Big Data skills.  We provide a cloud environment that you can run through the browser of your laptop at NO cost to you.  Our meetups are FREE.

Meetup topics include:

- Hadoop-based analytics

- Stream Computing

- Text Analytics

- Visualization and Discovery tools for Big Data

- Big Data App Development

- Deep dives into the technologies that makes big data processing possible

- Anything and everything about Big Data

Join us today for a hands on software development experience.
results.name: Big Data Developers in NYC

We're evaluating member requests on a case-by-case basis to make sure it's a good fit for everyone, and that we stay focused to our discussions about running enterprise WordPress websites.

results.description: The Society of Quantitative Analysts (SQA) is a not-for-profit organization that focuses on education and communication to support members of the quantitative investment practitioner community. We seek to encourage the dissemination of leading-edge ideas and innovations relevant to the work of the quantitative investment practitioner. The knowledge of such ideas and innovations can assist portfolio and risk managers, strategists, analysts, traders, regulators, asset owners such as pension sponsors and foundations in performing their functions and responding to the ever-quickening pace of change. The Society welcomes the participation of academics and students. The SQA provides forums for the presentation of theory and practice by practitioners, academics and regulators with an emphasis on the new and controversial. The Society holds monthly meetings in New York City from September through June. Monthly meetings consist of one-hour talks on a specific topic. The Society also organizes a half-day seminar in the fall on a topic of current interest and a full-day "Fuzzy Day" seminar in the spring on an exporatory topic.
results.name: Society of Quantitative Analysts - NYC

As a gay or bisexual man attracted to men in the New York City tri-state area, you have a positive outlook on life and want to get the most out of life and relationships. Personal growth, meaningful relationships and a fulfilling life are important to you.

You want to pursue a healthy lifestyle, expand your knowledge and skills, and connect with like minded men. The idea of exploring and moving forward on real issues in a safe and fun environment is appealing to you.

You're open to new ideas and ways of thinking. You might be inspired to grow out of your comfort zone so you boldly make new mistakes rather than repeating the same old ones.

If you are interested in transforming your life and opening doors to new possibilities, you will want to be a part of Men Growing Together™ along with other NYC gay and bisexual men.

Our group gives you the chance to explore the things that are truly important, learning and growing with other men. We promote social and economic justice. We seek fair opportunity for all and privilege for none.

We explore how wealth is created and shared. We examine the impact of trade and technology on our economy. Our objective is to create jobs, raise incomes, provide affordable housing, and protect our environment.

For us, “Social reform is not to be secured by noise and shouting; by complaints and denunciation; by the formation of [political] parties or the making of revolutions; but by the awaking of thought and the progress of ideas. results.description:
NY Career Meetup is a information and networking group that connects job seekers with Managers and Employers who make hiring decisions through its events.The group connects job seekers and Recruiters, Hiring managers and Employers and gives them a chance to know about employment opportunities and gather information about companies/ individuals who are currently hiring for both part time and full time positions.

NY Career Meetup gives job seekers best opportunity to make connections face to face with Managers and Employers.NY Career Meetup and its events allow the opportunity for both parties to check possibilities for prospective employment.

NY Career Meetup provides great opportunity for Job search networking Or Career Networking.60% of all jobs are found by networking. It's true, some of the best jobs are never advertised. Many are filled by successful job seekers who networked with the right people and got the job before it was ever advertised. Employers love referrals and first look to tap their own workers for people they know that can fill open positions. It's cheaper and provides for more quality employees. People do business primarily with people they k9now and like. Resumes and cover letters alone are often too impersonal to convince employers to hire. Networking makes you a recommended member of a much smaller pool. Networking leads to information and job leads, often before a formal job description is created or a job is announced. There is more to successful networking than just talking to your friends. To be a successful networker you must have as many contacts as possible hear your pitch and understand that you are in the job market.

FB LINK - https://www.facebook.com/NyCareerGroup
results.name: NY Career Meetup

results.description:
This is an exclusive networking group for Wedding Professionals who serve the high-end wedding market in Manhattan. There are three requirements to be a part of this meetup group.

  1. You provide professional services to brides and grooms.
  2. You serve the high-end wedding market.
  3. You are based in the New York City area (you can have offices/outlets in other locations).

 

This is a business networking group for wedding/bridal professionals in the categories Accommodations, Bridal Fashions, Bridal Jewelry, Bridal Party, Bridal Party Gifts, Cakes, Catering, Ceremony Sites, Dance Lessons, Decorations, DJ, Entertainment, Event Insurance, Favors, Flowers, For the Men, Health & Beauty, Honeymoon, Invitations, Live Music, Officiants, Photo Booth Rentals, Photographers, Pre-wedding Events, Premarital Counseling, Real Estate, Registry, Rehearsal Dinner, Rentals, Transportation, Travel Agencies, Tuxedos & Suits, Venues, Videography & Film, Wedding Planners etc., who serve the Manhattan high-end wedding market. The high-end wedding market is around 4% of the overall wedding market and typically constitutes of weddings with a budget of $100,000 or higher. 2011 saw 5,476 such weddings in Manhattan, with a total spending of approximately $820 million.

The idea behind creating this group is to get together a small group (preferably only one or two members from a category) of top of the line wedding professionals who use group synergy to capture the largest share of the Manhattan high-end wedding market. Individuals are like the five fingers on your hand. If you can get them all together, you have a fist. The advantages of numbers is huge. When operating as a group, or I must say, as a TEAM, 1 and 1 is not 2. It is actually 11. Eventually this will be a closed group where members will vote on other members so that the group on the whole will always have the best.

-----------------------------------------

How could you have a soccer team if all were goalkeepers? How would it be an orchestra if all were French horns?  -- Desmond Tutu


The nice thing about teamwork is that you always have others on your side. -- Margaret Carty

------------------------------------------
results.name: Manhattan Wedding Professionals

results.description:
Hoboken Young Professionals("HYP") was formed to bring driven and passionate young professionals together every month.  We at HYP believe that developing and nurturing your professional network is the cornerstone to success.  Luckily, we already have all the young talent we need right here in the area.  Here are a few quick points so you understand what HYP is all about:

1. What happens at these events? We typically set a time at a bar in Hoboken to hold very informal meetings.  There is no agenda other than to meet other professionals, hold engaging conversations and have a few drinks.

2. Is there suggested dress attire? Clothes have no barring on the quality of networking.  It is very common to see members in jeans or shorts.

3. Should I bring something to the event? We usually have some very interesting people in attendance with diverse careers.  We suggest you bring some new ideas or talking points.  You never know where your next career altering insight will flourish from so mix it up!

4. Any advice? If you are involved in sales please refrain from attending in hopes of generating quick business.  A member's main focus should be to give to the group and let relationships develop naturally.

5. Who is considered a young professional? For purposes of the group it is 40 and below.  However, no one is going to be asking your age ;).

6. Do I have to live in Hoboken to attend an event? Absolutely not.  It is very common for members to be from the surrounding towns or the city.
results.name: HOBOKEN YOUNG PROFESSIONALS

results.description:
Members of W. A. Nyland’s Chardavogne Group will hold a series of meetings in Manhattan starting in September of 2014.  Discussion will focus on how the ideas of Gurdjieff relate to an individual’s spiritual development in today’s complex and turbulent world. Mr. Nyland was a serious student and teacher of Gurdjieff’s ideas for over 50 years, andtoday his group continues, providing a vital source for the study and practice of work on oneself.

EVERYONE IS WELCOME!

For the time and place of these meetings call the Chardavogne Barn at 845-258-4655 For more information regarding G.I. Gurdjieff and W.A. Nyland visit http://www.nyland.org

In 1924 Mr. Nyland heard Gurdjieff speak during his first visit to United States, and soon became an active member of the new group set up by Gurdjieff in New York, with A.R. Orage at the head. From that beginning, Mr. Nyland became dedicated to the practical application of Gurdjieff’s Ideas for the rest of his life. He traveled several times to France to work with Gurdjieff, helped Gurdjieff when he made his various tater trips to America, and continued with his own personal efforts to apply what Gurdjieff taught as self-development, or work on oneself.

Near the end of his life, Gurdjieff asked Mr. Nyland to start a group in America, for which he would receive special material every week. After Gurdjieff died in 1949, Mr. Nyland was one of the founders and trustees of the Gurdjieff Foundation. He remained active in the Foundation until he formed his own independent group in the early 1960s.

In the late 1960s, Mr. Nyland established a center in the country, in Warwick, NY, where he purchased property now known as Chardavogne Barn. His group in California also purchased property in Sonoma county, near San Francisco, now known as The Land. At these and other branches of his group, he conducted many meetings, Gurdjieff movements, and workdays for physical activities. His group continues today with these activities.
results.name: Mr Nyland's Chardavogne Gurdjieff group New York

How we can remove relationship failure from our lives. How we can destroy jealousy and possessiveness. In short, this group is for anyone interested in dating, relationships, human sexual psychology and improving their love lives.

results.description:
Who We Are
This group exists to bring together technology entrepreneurs solving local business challenges and local businesses looking to grow.

What We Do
Using a mixture of presentation and discussion formats, we provide a forum for members and invited guests to share their business challenges and knowledge, and to present their expertise and the projects and products they are working on.

Who Should Join
"Local businesses looking to grow" can include anyone selling anything to customers "locally." This can be national chains or individual proprietorships. Those who will get the most out of the group will be owners and executives looking to exploit emerging technologies to can give them an edge in the marketplace.

"Tech entrepreneurs solving local business challenges" should be founders or executives of startups or leaders of internal innovation units of established corporations who are developing new technologies that will help local businesses better reach and serve their customers.

We will aim to have a balance of members from both communities, and to invite presenters and panelists from a cross-section of relevant businesses and fields of expertise.

results.description: Do you love literature and perhaps music and art as well--but somehow you’ve never really “got” poetry? Would you like to learn to get the joy from poems you get from other works of art without going through English Lit 101 again? If your answers are yes I can help. It started with a friend whom I met in discussion groups of Joyce’s Ulysses and Proust’s Remembrance of Things Past. He loved literature and music (he was a Jazz musician and is very knowledgeable about classical music as well). Yet, though he knew there was great beauty in poetry, he just didn’t “get” it. We started discussing poetry in general and soon began weekly discussions of specific great poems. The challenge for me was how to make poetry come alive to him yet cover the critical components of poetry in a meaningful and interesting way—to help him enjoy the beauty in Poetry that he enjoyed so much in literature and music. These discussions have been a great success and a great joy to both of us. He has come to love poetry with the same passion he has felt for music and literature. Now I’d like to share with others what we learned. So, I am starting a Peotry discussion group—I will facilitate but it’ll be discussions not lectures or lessons. Together we will learn to understand and then love great poems. If you are interested, just join the Great Poetry group on Meetup. As soon as we have 5 or more members I will contact you and we’ll pick a schedule and a venue in Manhattan and then we’ll start. Larry Schiff
results.name: Great Poetry: read /discuss / learn to love--in Mahattan

Having visited a lot of business Meetups, we saw a lot of great people with great ideas. Some of them have already started their first companies, others are just thinking of doing it, and others trying to promote their companies’ products or services. Also, there are plenty of talented people who are looking for investors and business networking. So, that's the main reason we decided to launch this Meetup in cooperation with the NY newspaper: StartupsNY.

We will help you get necessary information to develop and promote your startup in a more effective way. Moreover, we will interview investors to give you information on what they are looking for and what they want to see in your startup. We hope we will help you get financial resources for your growing business. At our Meetup, you will always be able to find useful information about internet marketing, ideas on how to advertise your business, information about upcoming Meetups and, of course, information about NY startups.

We are a social-based company, and would like to offer you the opportunity to post information about your startups in our partner's newspaper for free. results.description: If you are interested in healing yourself in any area of your life, be it for stress, overwhelm, health, finances, relationships or professional life, this is the group for you. We meet once a month to experience EFT (Emotional Freedom Techniques), facilitated by EFT performance coach Gail Mae Ferguson. Gail Mae is a Certified Level 3 Advanced EFT Practitioner and Workshop Leader. She has been facilitating workshops and working with clients in NYC now for over 5 years. EFT is a simple but powerful self-help tool that aims to clear energetic blocks that cause the physical or emotional issue. Everyone can learn to do it for themselves, and continue using it after the sessions. Improvements can often be felt in a very short time, in fact participants get relief and results during the evening. I know that some people are suffering enormous stress and worry. Come and learn this simple technique to not only help yourself but also have support from the group.There is power in numbers through what we call "Borrowing Benefits. Come and learn more about it. To learn more about Emotional Freedom Techniques and about Gail Mae go to. www.gailmae.com.

results.description:
This is a Meetup geared toward the exploration of computational cancer research. We will not adhere to a formal academic model, where presentations focus on scientific results. Instead we will survey the landscape of open questions in the field and discuss the utility of existing models, libraries, databases, etc. in solving the biological mysteries. Key topics of interest include machine learning methods, high throughput sequencing, clinical data mining, tumor evolution, drug response prediction, and many more.

Presentations are encouraged from our own members, though outside speakers are also invited to speak. All presentations and code are freely available through: https://github.com/NYC-OPCCR
results.name: NYC Open Problems in Computational Cancer Research

results.description: Let’s face it. Being a stepparent is hard. Even in the best of situations, there are adjustments that need to be made – physically, financially and most of all, emotionally. Unfortunately, “step” has become one of those taboo topics that people don’t talk about enough. While it has become more and more common – did you know that over 1300 new stepfamilies are forming every day? – the support surrounding these families has not kept up with the demand. That’s where Stepfamily Solutions of NYC Meetup Group comes in. The group is led by a Stepfamily Foundation Certified Coach and provides a forum for you to share your challenges and more importantly, to find solutions. Who better to help us navigate this maze of step than others who are also finding their way through? If you are an official stepparent or in a committed relationship with someone who has children and would like to meet others who get what you’re going through, come join us.
results.name: Stepfamily Solutions of NYC Meetup Group

We believe that to give good feedback we have to tell the writer what worked well first, what moved us, what inspired us, what made us want to punch something or someone. results.description:
NYC UX Acrobatics primary focus is the varied facets of UX design, research and usability. Our aim is to create monthly 'UX themed' workshop style meetings where members work with each other learning, discovering and networking on all things UX.

Potential topics: paper prototyping, experience maps, user research and testing, persona dev, a/b testing, front-end best practices, RWD (Responsive Web Design), PET Design (Persuasion, Emotion, and Trust Design), competitive analysis, sketching UX, content strategy, gamification, conversion optimization, expert reviews/heuristics, etc...

Finally, this meetup will not be limited to workshops alone. We also intend to have presentations on UX trends, best practices and methodologies from leading experts in their field.

About the name:

UX Acrobatics is a term used to express the varied and multi-disciplinary skills UX professionals have to possess in today's rapidly evolving digital world.

Just as real acrobatics use their coordination, flexibility and agility to perform amazing feats; UX professionals are required to have the mental agility to balance project objectives and scope while focusing on the best user experience, the technical flexibility to balance design and development constraints, with the coordination to reach deadlines while working across departments and job functions.

results.description:
The Society of Environmental Journalists is dedicated to furthering credible, robust journalism that informs and engages society on environmental issues. This SEJ NYC Meetup group seeks to build and sustain the professional ties between environmental journalists and editors in all media, who live and/or work in the New York City metro area.

We welcome new meet up members. You do not need to be a member of SEJ to join this group! But, you do need to fit into one of SEJ's current membership categories. Members include professional journalists across all media; independent writers and producers; journalism teachers and students; and staff journalists at universities, non-media companies and other organizations. Click here to learn more about SEJ's membership categories.

When applying to the group, please include your full name, as well as the requested information to verify your professional journalist, educator or student standing. (Students: If you have yet to publish/air/screen any reporting, please note that and we'll be in touch.) We cannot guarantee a response if those data are not supplied!
results.name: Society of Environmental Journalists NYC

results.description:
French with a Focus meets in quiet places where we can eat and drink and really yap it up in French. I host some dinner parties at my apartment on the Upper West Side. We cook together, have absolutely delicious food and wine, and love the language dearly. This group is about high-quality French practice and meeting other awesome lovers of French language and culture. Our level tends to be from intermediate to native, and we like to keep things just about entirely in French. So, if you're a beginner, you'll probably do a lot of deciphering and depuzzling of a beautiful but sometimes bewildering language that sounds like a blur to the non-accustomed ear. So, come for the relatively intricate French conversation and food. Friends are very welcome!

If you're rather seeking out an international social nightlife -- like clubbing and pubbing in English with a mix of francophones and others -- then there are some other Meetup groups that we have ties to. I'm happy to make introductions if you ilke.

- Erik, le Moderateur

This group was formerly called, "French With A Focus"
results.name: Cuisine & Conversation Française !

results.description: This group is for 20-something girls living in NYC who like to go out and have fun! If you are looking for a group of cool girls to hit the bars with, but want to leave the drama behind then this may be the group for you. The rules of this group are very simple: 1. Do not bring drama - it will not be tolerated! 2. Show up ready to have fun! I will not be taking attendance at events or kicking anyone out for not attending enough events. This has always seemed ridiculous to me. I wouldn't stop being friends with someone just because they couldn't hang out one night and I'll give you that same respect. That said, you'll obviously get more out of the group and make more solid friendships if you attend events on a regular basis. The events will mostly consist of happy hours, weekend nights out, brunches, etc. Every event doesn't have to involve drinking, but we're young and living in one of the greatest cities in the world so why not live it up while we can! Also, just because I am the organizer doesn't mean that I am the only one who can plan events. I want group members to feel free to suggest/plan things to do. So if you're looking to make new friends, drink a few cocktails and have some fun nights out then join us at our next meetup! Can't wait to meet you! Katherine

results.description: We are a Chinese EB-5 Investor Awareness group. results.description:
El Centro de Educación de Trabajadores has been serving the Hell's Kitchen community since 1975. Through evening education programs, community organizing and cultural events, we help students learn new languages and participate in an exciting cultural exchange. Classes are offered in Spanish, English and Mandarin. We also offer a free Intercambio (English/Spanish language exchange) class Tuesday evenings. An all-volunteer teaching and administrative staff makes classes available at low cost. Our teachers are Native speakers and bring both a passion for teaching and a love of language into every classroom. We are located at Hartley House, a Community Center and Settlement House, serving the Clinton and Hell’s Kitchen neighborhoods since 1897.

Our classes are not wheelchair accessible. They are located on the 2nd-4th floors of a building without an elevator.

results.description:
What we believe:

We believe there is profound beauty and value in the act of creating.

We believe it takes a community to sustain creativity.

We believe Newark deserves to be a community of creators.

 

What does our name mean?

Brick City = Newark, NJ

Creators = People who bring something into existence.

Catalysts = People who incite activity or change.

BC3 = A spiffy acronym for the group!

 

What we aim to accomplish:

We aim to be a organizing, educational and networking platform in the greater Newark area, particularly in the creative fields (Advertising, Architecture, Arts, Branding, Crafts, Design, Fashion, Film, Video, Photography, PR, Mobile, Music, Visual and Performing Arts, Publishing, Radio, Television, and Web).

We will promote events, initiatives and opportunities for education, business development, training, partnerships, networking, funding, marketing, special access, incentives, jobs, internships, and more.

As our name implies, we not only welcome "creators", but also "catalysts" who make it possible to create locally. Creators can range from filmmakers to music producers to artists and more, and catalysts can be found among business and non-profit executives, entrepreneurs, philanthropists, and more.

We are based in Newark but welcome 'creators and catalysts' from New Jersey, and even those brave New Yorkers who see life and opportunity on the other side of the Hudson.

 

How did we get here?

The Brick City Creators + Catalysts (BC3) is the evolution of the Newark Entertainment Roundtable Forum (NERF), launched by the Newark Office of Film + Television, which met throughout 2012 in rotating venues in Newark.

NERF accomplished its goal of identifying, bringing together and listening to community, business leaders, producers and artists, who are committed to boosting Newark as a creative hub. NERF gathered their contacts, stories and experiences, shared updates related to the film, arts and entertainment in the area and introduced participants to the new Newark Office of Film + Television.

Thanks to the participation of over 100 "catalysts", the NERF charted a path forward for creators and related businesses and organizations in the Newark area.

 

What's next?

In 2013, the BC3 aims to build on the NERF's "legwork" and set action-oriented, community-building goals and projects to grow / benefit the Newark, NJ creator and catalyst community.

We plan to hold the first BC3 meetup in January/February 2013.

If you are a creator, a catalyst or plan on becoming one, join us and share your skills, challenges and dreams!

Meanwhile, we invite you to visit the Newark Office of Film + Television's website www.newarkfilmtv.com to learn about fellow creators, latest news and local opportunities.
results.name: Brick City Creators + Catalysts (BC3)

results.description:
The Mobile Apps Roulette meetup is for interactive iOS/Android demos with full audience participation.  Instead of just watching demos then asking questions, we the audience use each app as it's being presented.

Many mobile apps today have a social and/or location component and so having a group of people using them at the same time provides a valuable use case for the apps' developers and interesting audience interactions.

At the beginning of each meetup, all attendees download the apps that'll be presented in the meetup (open wifi provided).

By using the apps during the demos rather than just watching, attendees can give better feedback and the demos are more fun because presenters tailor them for audience participation.

Our meetups are held at Space-4-Work in Greenwich Village.

Pizza and sodas provided.

 

----

If you are interested in presenting your iOS or Android app, contact the meetup's organizer.
results.name: Mobile Apps Roulette

results.description:
Imagine…

Hundreds of New Yorkers coming together in small groups of neighbors

and fellow citizens to discuss topics of intensive interest…

Hosted at no cost and at convenient locations and times…

Aided by simple guiding principles…

Inspired by the city’s grand tradition of robust conversation…


Our vision is to inspire, organize, publicize, facilitate and celebrate a renaissance of healthy dialogue in New York City.

Our Mission:

1. Encourage and support interesting and important conversations among New Yorkers at the grass-roots level,

2. Establish simple, affordable, and sustainable infrastructure to foster such conversations throughout the city year-round.

3. Add to the worldwide image of New York as a metropolis where culture and intellect thrive among the people.

4. Organize the plethora of conversations happening in the city and have them listed in one central and easily-accessible spot.

5. Maintain conversations with a human face by discussing topics in-person, while also allowing for further discussion online.

Note:  For access to all CNY-sponsored events, go to http://www.conversationsnewyork.com and subscribe to our blog,

and "Like" our Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/conversationsnewyor....
results.name: "Conversations New York"

results.description:
The Age of Enlightenment was one of the most important periods in the history of thought. It gave birth not only to deists and freethinkers, but also to democratic ideals and the scientific method.

Perhaps most important was David Hume's idea that mankind's next project as a civilization should be to found a "science of human nature" -- a body of concepts that would help us distinguish between the fixed characteristics of human nature and those flexible dimensions in which individuals develop unique qualities. If we had such a science, we could stop fighting our nature and focus on developing those assets our nature is designed to acquire -- things like truth and right, knowledge and ability, insights and skills.

Come join a small group of men and women who meet every month in Manhattan to discuss books and other media that relate broadly to themes of intellectual liberation and social progress, and more specifically to the question "Who are we and what are we capable of?"

In addition to books, we'll read shorter works like essays, speeches, anthologies split up into two or more sessions, and works that our members have written. Also, our scope will be considerably wider than just the philosophical discoveries of the 18th-century. Whatever our members want to read will be considered objectively and voted on democratically. Your hosts are Dean Hannotte and Rachel Bartlett and our website is The Enlightenment Book Club.
results.name: The Enlightenment Book Club

results.description:
Women's Society of Cyberjutsu is a 501c3 organization whose mission is to advance women in Cybersecurity.

Membership is comprised of Women either in the Information Security field or wanting to enter the field. We provide training (workshops, study groups, classes, mentoring, networking, internship/job placement assistance & resource-sharing, and opportunities.

We use meetup.com as an event notification platform and also use a mailing list to foster communication between members. You'll want to become a member via the website to take advantage of all the benefits! Membership options are: Full, Student/Military, Free and Associate (for our male friends).

New and seasoned professionals are encouraged to join. Our hashtag is #womenscyberjutsu

Topics covered:

Penetration Testing, Exploitation, Password Cracking, Buffer Overflows, Shellcode, Vulnerability Assessment, Rootkits, Website/Web App Testing – XSS, CSRF, SQL Injection, Browser Exploitation,   Information Assurance, OSINT, Certification & Accreditation – DIACAP, NIST, Tools of the trade – Metasploit, Nessus, Nmap, Burp Suite, Wireshark, Malware Analysis,  Certification Study – CISSP, CEH, ECSA, Security+, Digital Forensics, Auditing, Reverse Engineering, Risk Assessments, Computer & Network Forensics, Wireless, Network Analysis, Social Engineering, Cryptography, VOIP, Architecture Standards, Incident response, Compliance & Governance, Business Continuity, SCADA, Disaster Recovery, Mobile
results.name: Women in Cybersecurity - Information Security - NY

I am an ordained High Priestess and In this group we talk about what it is like to be a pagan parent, problems, issues, homeschooling, crafts, and events happening on Long Island in Nassau County NY and surrounding Counties. This group is open to anyone with an open mind of course and all earth based religions. People from other locations will still find interest in this group, but to meet up with would be a challenge! I would like to start meeting up at the local venues where here in Nassau County! My local library is RVC public library, and another few venues where we can meet up are local parks, Dinners, and Bars for adult only nights. Of course we are always going to expand the venues as more meet ups are scheduled! So far we meet up once a month for individuals and or their families to come on the last Saturday of every month at the Baldwin Coach Dinner located in Baldwin on Sunrise Hwy, across from the Baldwin Train Station. Eventually I would like to make those meet ups twice a month so we can discuss possible fund raisers to light of our pockets so we can plan trips and activities. As of right now we meet once a month and come together to discuss topics of interest, problems that might be affecting you or others in the community, and sort of community service that we could suggest, and or activities, as well as future events and meetings. I would like to start children's book readings again which we will start out as once every other week and depending on the outcome we will either make it once a month or or even better would be every week! Of course with that in mind for children I would like to start arts and crafts again now that the holidays are nearing and there are many things we can plan so they can have fun! Oh excuse me I almost forgot that I wanted to inform everyone how I created a scouting group meetup page and for who are interested for further information please go to http://www.meetup.com/AllMotherEarthsChildr.... Please feel free to Contact me for further information!

Blessed Be, High Priestess Jeanann

In addition to inviting you to the many large, multi-group networking events that I host @ 230 Fifth each year, I'll also host events there exclusively for the members of our group! This will give you a rare opportunity to connect with old friends and make new ones @ one of the top clubs in NYC!

To see pics from both The Enclosed Penthouse Lounge & The Rooftop Garden check out our Election Night Party @ 230 Fifth!

For the best in New York Nightlife, check out their website: 230 Fifth.com 

As well as our sister group, (6100+members) "The New York City Social Networking Meetup Group"

And my website: TastingNYC.com

I hope to see you @ our next event!

results.description:
The Stamford IBD Meetup group welcomes anyone who is interested in investing from beginning to advanced. We are dedicated to teaching the CAN SLIM Investing System described in William O'Neil's 'How to Make Money in Stocks'. You do not need to be an Investor's Business Daily subscriber to join and membership is free, but we do recommend you read O'Neil's book to get the most out of the Meetup group.

Each month, we will discuss the current market outlook, discuss stocks of interest and focus on one or more elements of CAN SLIM investing.

We look forward to seeing you at a Meetup soon!

topics.name: Trying New Things with Like Minded People!

results.description:
Get off the couch and just do it! If you thought, "I should do that" or "I should go there," then this group is for you.<br> <br> We are going to touch the stars, travel through time, eat tasty and decadent delights, learn to fly, laugh til we cry, and much more! Together, let's do the things we used to love, the things we'd like to try, and maybe even things we never thought we'd do.

We transcend labels. There is no age minimum or limit. Relationship status is irrelevant because you can come alone or bring a significant other. Just come and enjoy yourself with some interesting and inviting people! More importantly, try something new!

Meetups will mostly be in NJ, but we'll also venture to NY, PA, and beyond.

results.description:
Hack Manhattan is located on 137 West 14th Street between Union Square and Chelsea. We are dedicated to technology, art and craft. Our physical space is open every Tuesday and Thursday evening. A smaller 3D printing foucsed group gathers on Thursday evenings, and it’s possible to visit the space and use our facilities at other times whenever a member is hosting.

A lot of our activities have focused on electronics and 3D printing, but we also have a machine shop with a lathe and a mill, sewing machines, gardening and even a beehive on the roof.

Tech Tuesday is the weekly open night at Hack Manhattan, a community hackerspace in the Union Square neighborhood of Manhattan. Stop by to chat about your projects and use our electronics tools, 3D printers, sewing machines or machine shop. Everyone is encouraged to bring a project to work on!

Most of the community activity happens on Blabber, our discussion mailing list.
results.name: Hack Manhattan

results.description: Want to meet and work with active film industry professionals? What about attending red carpet premieres and networking events at prestigious venues with reps from major, well known entertainment companies? Want to join the circles of New York's up and coming directors, producers and actors? Of course you said yes, we don't need to ask. The Filmmakers Network is one of the only meet ups that doesn't focus on workshops and seminars...but actually making the cogs in the New York film industry mesh. We're the guys out and about all over the city making our films. Founded by a production company in New York with tithes to some big names in entertainment, its our goal to do one thing and one thing only...make films. Just a few examples of our works to come: private film screenings, script readings, film premieres, film shoots (shorts and features) and not to mention getting to know one another on a close personal level. Want to join us?
results.name: THE FILMMAKERS NETWORK

We host events in Europe and are now looking to expand the network to the US - with interesting people to meet at events, and a website full of up-to-date industry news, views and interviews Who goes to BookMachine parties? Well, a combination of people really. First of all you've got publishing professionals - designers, editors, publishers, marketeers, sales professionals. Then there's book lovers and writers. And not to forget, a few app developers, games designers and publishing students. What do you actually do? We've organised talks, gimmicks and contests in the past, but we've found that the best ingredients for a good party are simply a great venue, chatty people and some drinks. topics.name: Teachings of The Ancient Egyptian Mystery Schools

results.description:
Does it seem that our modern society has fallen out of step with our long held traditions and social mores? The Center for the Restoration of Ma'at seeks to reconnect us with the ancient wisdom of Egypt (Kemet). Activities include monthly museum tours, college-level courses (in-person and online), lectures/workshops, and annual study tours to Egypt and other international locations. The Center also produces the weekly television show, Kemetic Legacy Today.

The Center is directed by Jabari Osaze. Brother Osaze has been studying Ancient Egypt for 25 years, and has led annual tours in Egypt since 2002. He is also a Kemetic priest and is currently establishing the Shrine of Ma'at.
results.name: Ancient Egyptian (Kemet) Awakening

results.description: With roots buried deeply in Appalachia and influences spanning much of Europe and Africa, bluegrass music is more than a musical genre. It acts as a common language of sharp guitar melodies and banjo runs that have bridged cultural and generational gaps for more than a century. Today, many of the most talented Bluegrass musicians and passionate admirers play and live throughout Brooklyn, New York. This Meetup is to serve as a public forum for sharing and planning events related to bluegrass music.

results.description: A3E is a Business-to-Business Exchange Dedicated to the Exploration of New Technologies & Apps that are Transforming the Music Industry and the Creative Process of Musicians & Audio Professionals. A3E has uniquely targeted and is creating a business-to-business exchange, and environment, for the 3 critical components and communities that make up the creative aspect of the music and professional audio industry; 1. musicians and audio professionals, 2. music and audio technology manufacturers, 3. music and audio software developers. The interaction and symbiotic relationship between these three ecosystems is where the paradigm shifts, the new applications and the new business models are and will be emerging from. A3E is at the core of these universes and A3E’s mission is to facilitate and create an Exchange of information, data, technologies and relationships that will help all these individuals and organizations build the best products, create the best music and content, as well as drive the most profitable businesses possible.

results.description:
Manhattan is our paradise garden with ample photographic opportunities. This group is for amateur photographers who would like to improve their skills through practice and sustained self education. Why do some photographs work while some do not? How should we correctly expose a photograph? I am an amateur myself, and do not know all the answers. However, much of the enjoyment of photography is the thinking process that goes on before the shutter is clicked. We will read books, practice and most importantly teach each other as we learn. And Manhattan in all its variety will be our playground.

My intent is to put together a group of regulars, and together we will be set ourselves on a path of self education in photography. This group is for you if (a) you have the dedication and time to devote to photography, (b) have a digital camera with manual settings, (c) open to constructive criticism of your work. The current plan is:

  • One meeting will be to discuss composition. I have chosen Michael Freeman's series: The Photographer's Eye. We will discuss one chapter, and take/share photographs illustrating the materials.
  • The second meeting will be to discuss exposure. This is much easier to learn, so in the future we will probably have a combination of other digital or technical issues like Lightroom.
  • I'd also like to put together informal photowalks over some weekends to actually go out and practice what we learn. These plans will evolve as we come together as a group.

So if you are a dedicated amateur with the time to devote and looking for similar minded people,welcome and see you all at the next meeting.
results.name: A Walk in Paradise Garden

results.description:
The FinTech Hackathon | www.fintechhack.com

The goal of the FinTech Hackathon is to promote the development of financial technology for institutional customers and consumers.

The Hackathon brings together FinTech developers and designers to develop financial products and discover new technologies. Example applications include innovations in risk management, trading, big data, retail banking, regulatory compliance, mobile payments and enterprise social.

APIs and platforms from technology partners will be made available during the Hackathon. Attendees will spend 24 hours coding, validating their ideas, networking and then demoing their hacks to a panel of FinTech VCs, executives and entrepreneurs.

results.description: This is a group for anyone interested in research concerning artificial neural networks, deep learning, and so on. The format varies between discussion groups, guest speakers, and tutorials. Proposed topics include: training deep belief networks with unsupervised pre-training/supervised finetuning, recurrent neural networks, different optimization methods, scalable architectures for large networks across clusters, practical GPU programming (with Python!), NNs for NLP, using NNs in robotics, visualizations to monitor NN learning, and other stuff specific to these areas of research. Recent developments in this area of research show a lot of promise, but very few people within the machine learning community have any practical experience with these methods. Since there's so few of us, we should get together and share notes!
results.name: NYC Neural Network Aficionados Discussion Group

results.description:
Bodhi Meditation is a form of energy healing.

Bodhi Meditation is unique in the following ways

1). It channels universal energy rather than working with what’s within one person. It transcends the genetic and physical limits of just one being by relying and drawing energy from the entire universe.

2). The entire human body is the receiver of this energy. The energy’s effects on the body do not rely on certain meridian paths or pressure points of the body, which are the common requirements for many types of the Qi Gong practices.

 

Student Testimonial:

"From the very moment that I met Nan , I knew that she was going to be someone very special to me! I met her at the Navel expo in November 2012. I had been looking for someone to teach me to meditate at that time, and the moment I joined her and a small group of people at the expo, i immediately began to feel the energy and power of Nan...I could see all the colors of  my chakras, like a light show inside of me,and felt  intense energy that was what i would describe as healing love. She is truly an amazing and gifted soul !!!"" Bonnie, Bodhi Meditation @ the Navel Expo November 2012

 

How can I expect to benefit from Bodhi Meditation?

Meditation has been used successfully in conjunction with conventional medical treatments.

In the Western medical world, it has already been applied to treat the following:

1. Addiction-related issues, ranging from behavior awareness to withdrawal symptom management for narcotics, nicotine, and alcohol dependencies

2. Cancer-related issues

3. High blood pressure: a report from the National Institutes of Health (NIH) recommends meditation as one of the primary treatments for high blood pressure

4. HIV-related issues

5. Menopausal symptoms

6. Pain issues and responses

7. Stress, anxiety and depression

The practice of Bodhi methods benefits both the body and the mind.

Physical benefits of Bodhi Meditation may include:

1. The regulation of arterial and nervous system disease (e.g., fatigue, headaches, insomnia, nervous breakdown, etc.)

2. Amelioration of lower back and spinal pain, numbness of the extremities, rheumatism and neurovascular illness

3. Improvement of liver, gallbladder, spleen, stomach and kidney function, as well as relief from diseases of the internal organs

4. Treatment of allergies

5. Notable improvements in overall physical condition and general appearance, including weight control

6. The clearing of mental distractions and impurities, facilitating the emergence of seemingly inexplicable abilities

7. The occurrence of a state in which, without intending so, a practitioner becomes unable or unwilling to eat, yet is relaxed and full of energy – it is known as "spontaneous fasting"

The psychological and spiritual benefits of Bodhi Meditation may include:

1. Increased patience and willpower

2. Increased mental agility and task proficiency

3. An improved ability to remain calm and emotionally grounded

4. A broader, more open heart, increased initiative and enthusiasm, plus greater motivation to help others

*********

If you can open your heart and relax your mind you will find this form of meditation beneficial to your health and spiritual well being.

 

Student testimonial:

"I have tried many different forms of meditation and yoga over the years. Though I have experienced some positive changes practicing over the years I never felt committed to practice on regular basis. Nan takes it to a whole other level. How and why? All I can say is you have to experience it for yourself. There is power in simplicity,love, and truth. Despite some language barriers(which are minor) You can feel her love and healing energy. Open your mind and see with a different set of eyes. I highly recommend her special Saturday classes." Michelina (Bodhi Meditation class Saturday November 15, 2014)

"Bodhi meditation has a focus on healing energy, you can experience this at each session. Much higher level of meditation in group than I can achieve doing my own practice. I was very happy to find a meditation group that was focused on bringing together community members to practice meditation. Bodhi meditation is unique because they offer free sessions to the community. Nan is a wonderful teacher, and very compassionate person. You can sense that she has extensive experience in oriental medicine including acupuncture, herbal medicine, and energy healing,. Thank you Nan. ” Joe (Bodhi Meditation class Wednesday October 29, 2014)

"Nan was quite the leader. She was funny, informative, and most of all, good at what she does. The class was well attended. I'd say there were 70 persons in the large room. The entire event ran from 6:45 to 8:40, nearly two hours. It didn't seem too long since about half of that time, our eyes were shut!" Alex (Bodhi Meditation NYC class Tuesday November 12, 2013)

"I was at Nan's Tuesday meditation meeting--the energy is wonderful! I came in with stomach pain which was almost completely gone after a few minutes of the meditation. Wonderful feelings of oneness and connection!" Pam (Bodhi Meditation NYC class Tuesday October 22, 2013)

"It was enlightening!!! Every time I practice Bodhi meditation, it feels like my Chi increases more and more! Thank you everyone for sharing this to NYC." Javoski (Bodhi Meditation NYC class Friday September 13, 2013)

"Nan emits healing energy -- the meditation is wonderful" Linda (Bodhi Meditation NYC class Friday September 13, 2013)

"Very calming and energizing. I did not have any negative thoughts or worries last night in bed like I always do. I felt my mind was clear. I will definitely go to another class" Dee (Bodhi Meditation NYC class Friday September 13, 2013)

"I Walked In With Lower Back Pain, Listened, Opened My Heart And Relaxed My Mind And Walked Out Feeling Better Than I Have In Almost Two Weeks. Thank You So Much. Looking Forward To Friday's " Ed (Bodhi Meditation NYC class Tuesday July 30, 2013)

"It was an amazing experience, Nan, you are truly a master. Can't wait to check out more of your classes!" Dan (Bodhi Meditation NYC class Tuesday July 23, 2013)
results.name: Bodhi Meditation with Nan - Join with an open heart.

results.description: This group is specifically for professionals in the digital retouching industry, who are in the NYC area (Manhattan and outer boroughs). Ideally, we would be able to network, provide mentoring, and share our experiences. Please be aware that if retouching is only a PART of what you do (that is, if you are a photographer who retouches their own work, for example), this is not the right group for you. results.description: Three of my favorite things to do are: figure drawing, making music, and playing games--all while sipping wine and and eating fancy cheeses with like-minded creative and fun people. To that end I am opening my house in Windsor Terrace Brooklyn for a once-or-twice-a-month get-together to anyone who would like to share in these activities. Whether you are an accomplished gamer, artist, and musician, or a novice that can barely play an instrument or draw, and never played Scrabble or Boggle in your life, you will fit in just fine. All evening long there will be figure drawing in the living room, live acoustic music in the foyer, and various board games in the dining room--and wine and cheese aplenty. Bring your drawing materials and/or an acoustic instrument (flutes, violins, voice, percussion, cellos, autoharps, digideroos, rain sticks, sitars, etc.--whatever you've got!) or just come for the games or just to hang out. The music jams will be loosely-structured new age/world music style improvisations around simple chord progressions and scales and will be easy enough that anyone--even if you can only play a single note--can join in. The figure drawing will be for practice only--no formal instruction. There will be one or two nude models posing throughout the evening in short poses and long poses. No paints or anything too messy please as the drawing session will be in a living room (not an art studio). Attendance at each Barefoot Fete will be limited to 20 people in order to maintain a gentle uncrowded vibe. And it's a barefoot fete because my wife and I have a no-shoes-in-the-house policy.
results.name: The Barefoot Fete - Figure Drawing, Music, Games, Wine

results.description: We all know that serious weight loss is about , "the journey - not the destination". But sometimes the journey can be lonely and overwhelming, so why not share it with a few others along the way? The Weight Loss Peer Support Connections group is a place where people making taking steps to change their life and habits can share information and experiences as we travel along our personal journeys. We will try new cuisines and share recipes that re-make old ones. Gain a deeper understanding of nutrition and find new ways to increase our fitness beyond the traditional (and often uncomfortable) gym workout. Along the way, we'll share some laughter and probably a few tears. Why face your journey alone when there is no need to?
results.name: Weight Loss Peer Support Connections

results.description:
Natural user interface (NUI) is about to take the world as the newest revolution in computing and devices. The next tech rock stars are the people developing NUI and the businesses they envision will be the next hot tech start-ups.

We are those people that are changing the world and the way people interact and experience things through our projects, products, and start-ups. We use voice control, voice recognition, facial recognition, eye tracking, gesture, motion capture, emotional response, sensors, artificial intelligence, and more, to control apps, devices, and systems in cool new ways.

If you're building applications or products, got a start-up or idea, want to share your skills and knowledge or learn from others, want to get in on tech's new leading edge, or are just a techno geek, this is the group for you! results.description: Buskers are aspiring musicians who perform live on the sidewalk, underground in a train station, or Central Park for free. Their musical styles range from acoustic to classical to folk and more. I was surprised to find there was not a single meetup dedicated to these adventurous musicians who play all over the world, so I thought I would create one. I have no idea where this will go. Perhaps we will find out where they play in advance and help build a fan base, or maybe we will find a venue and bring some musical talent together in NYC. I do not support panhandling or playing in subway trains, which can be distracting to a captive audience and sometimes dangerous. Please, let's keep it safe.

We created this meet-up in the hopes that we could develop a strong and dynamic NetSuite community with members from across the NetSuite spectrum. From industry executives to business owners reliant on the software and from coders and developers to NetSuite employees we feel that everyone brings a unique perspective and set of experiences to the table and together we can be greater than each individual.

The meet-up takes place on the second Wednesday of each month at Hara Partners' Midtown offices (locate us on Google Maps) and is the perfect way to stay abreast of the latest NetSuite developments and trade gossip and to foster relationships within the industry. Each meet-up, hosted by Hara Partners resident e-Commerce and NetSuite experts, features an in-depth look at a facet of NetSuite, often hosted by a guest expert form the field, and a meet-and-greet period during which members are encouraged to give an elevator pitch to introduce themselves and their business.

At Hara Partners we expect our members to be vocal: please use the message boards! (http://netsuite-meetup.harapartners.com/messages/boards/) We want to know what your experience has been with NetSuite, both as developers and users:  What did you enjoy; what problems did you face and how did you maximize NetSuite's potential for your business needs. We are particularly proud of our NetSuite-Magento Connector (http://www.harapartners.com/netsuite-magento-connector).

Members are encouraged to suggest any partnerships and sponsorships for the New York NetSuite Meet-up Group as well as request future topics.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meet-up to get our NetSuite ideas flowing!

The Hara Partners Team - “Focus on what you do best”.

http://www.harapartners.com

No recruitment or advertising of any kind is allowed on this site; Hara Partners reserves the right to accept/ban any members at our discretion.
results.name: New York NetSuite Meetup - NY Group - by harapartners.com

results.description:
Wouldn't you like to know who you're looking at?

Now you can -  by becoming a face reader.

Facial Analytics will improve your personal and professional relationships and give you real insight into a person's character, personality traits, strengths and weaknesses.

Facial Analytics can help you in every aspect of your life. In relationships and love, it can help you to identify your soul mate. In the workplace as an employer, to find the best person for the job and as a parent or child, to understand those family dynamics that frustrate and infuriate us all.

Talk about turning the odds in your favor. Come learn the ancient science of face reading, develop the tools to discover your soul mate, and meet others on the same journey.

 

What are the benefits to learning Facial Analytics?

Three components make up the basic process.

First - the attempt to understand who this individual in front of you is? What are they about? How can you as a teacher, leader, or healer best serve them?

Secondly - the process of learning to read faces has the effect of opening the heart energy. This increases our capacity for practicing compassionate comprehension. The magic of reading faces is that it can generate deep, empathic reasoning, and this makes it possible to contain the person deeply, ie. to contain their whole being in the space of your heart. It is truly an extraordinary thing to learn and teach others this ability to understand someone deeply and completely, free of our usual habit of trying to fit someone into a preconceived box.

The third thing that occurs when you learn to face read in this deeply empathic manner, is that you become healed yourself. You begin to understand that your experiences are shared, we are all sharing in the frailties and foibles of life with everyone around us. You will feel less alone, and perhaps more importantly, realize that we are all innocent victims of our environmental conditions. You will realize that even your parents who may have disappointed you (or worse), and even those who have hurt you, are innocent victims of the conditions of their environment.

While this does not mean that we will externally condone dysfunctional behavior, it will make it easier to internally forgive it.

 

About Atma, your Facial Analytics instructor.

Atma has been studying this emerging science of face reading for 13 years. In 2005, after six years of apprenticeship, he was given permission by Dr. Lincoln to teach and train others.

As an expert in Facial Analytics, Atma's methodology derives from combining his studies of ancient Vedic sciences and Western psychology.

With wisdom and insight gained from decades of academic research, rigorous and austere spiritual practice and real world business experience, Atma will guide you through the unlimited applications of face reading in one's personal and professional life and in the service of others.

Prepare for a heart opening journey that will explore the full gamut of human compassion and empathy and the absolute need for personal discipline and courage.

 

Get a face reading at howtoreadfaces.com
results.name: Facial Analytics - NY

results.description:
The Garden State Track Club (GSTC) is a non-profit organization that aims to serve all levels of runners in New Jersey. We offers individualized coaching plans for all runners, from beginners to elite athletes, and meet regularly for training runs and participate as a cohesive team in many races. Our team stresses the idea of "team," in that we have groups that meet daily for runs or workouts. If you meetup with us, you will be welcomed to run with new friends and reach your goals.

 

In addition to being part of the team, any runner has the opportunity to be part of one of the special training groups: Marathon/ Half Marathon Group, Mile-10k Distance Group, Couch to 5k Group, Sprints/Jumps/Hurdles, Throws, Rutgers Group, and Elite Group.

 

As a state-wide organization that promotes running in all parts of New Jersey, group runs, workouts, and social events happen both in the regional and Statewide level.

GSTC Headquarters - New Brunswick. This is also where many team meetings, team races, and team runs happen. The tow path, Six Mile Reservation, and Johnson Park are group favorites.

GSTC North Enclave - based in Saddle Brook; includes track workouts and team runs mostly at Garrett Mountain and Saddle River Park.

GSTC Beach Enclave - Mercer, Monmouth, and Ocean counties; runs on the boardwalk and often at Holmdel and Manasquan Reservoir.

GSTC South Encave - Camden County and greater Philadelphia; Wissahickon Trail is a favorite, along with numerous other trail runs along the river.

Email gardenstatetrackclub@gmail.com to be put in touch with an enclave captain near you!

 

The GSTC's goal is to provide direction for competitive runners of all levels, and to foster the future of New Jersey running by providing support to underprivileged young runners throughout the state. To these ends, we will develop structured training and meaningful race schedules for our members in all running venues: roads, cross-country, and track. Our fundraising efforts will enable us to provide guidance, equipment, and financial assistance to young runners in need. See also: http://www.gardenstatetc.org/
results.name: Garden State Track Club

Who should join us ?

Singles from the US, Europe, Africa, Asia, Oceania interested to meet other singles in New York City, and being interested in meeting people from various countries, religions, ethnics and cultures.

Why should you join ?

You should join us if you are single and interested in cultural diversity. You will have opportunities to learn from others, to challenge yourself, have fun, hopefully you will find the right special someone. Our members mingle, but they also make true friends, as members having found their soul mate through us are more than welcome to stay and share this experience.

Our members are singles and elite, but most importantly, they are unique, that's the thing that matters the most in everyone's quest for love. What can you expect out of our group ? Our typical activities will be going out together, meet, mingle, and learn from each others. We like the concept of speed dating but we think a "slow dating" event is even better, themed parties, watching movies, going together to museums exhibition and tours with curators.

 

What we are NOT and we do NOT do :

We respect individuals (you) as well as Meetup group's community guidelines. In particular :

● We don't primarily promote a product, business, venue or service

● We don't divert members to another website and we don't act as a lead generator for another website

● We never send spam and we don't primarily broadcast messages rather than have events

Jean-Philippe, Yara, and Rena

results.description:
Welcome to CrossConnection North Jersey, a church plant in the form of a Bible study serving northeast New Jersey! We are a little over one year into our church plant as we continue to build our core team. So what does that mean? Through God’s grace, we’re building the core of the church one person at a time with the goal of launching a Sunday service once we reach critical mass.

The whole of our mission could be summarized into three elements:

- Love God.
- Love Each Other.
- Make Disciples.

All that Jesus told the church to be and do is summarized in those three statements and therefore, that is our goal too. Our model for church growth is found in the Scriptures in Acts 2:42: “And they continued steadfastly in the apostles’ doctrine and fellowship, in the breaking of bread, and in prayers.” As such, we dedicate our time to the studying of the scriptures through our weekly Bible study and seek opportunities to gather in fellowship throughout the week for prayer.

If you’re in Bergen County and you’re looking for a church, or are interested in a grass-roots church plant movement, or simply have a pioneering spirit in the things of God, we invite you to come out and be a part of what God is doing through this church plant!

For more information please visit www.crossconnectionnj.org.

Blessings,

Jay

MISSION

Our mission at Rising Tides Alliance is to provide a professional and comfortable environment for business owners, entrepreneurs and business professionals to network while supporting charitable children's causes throughout the community, enlisting the values of relationships, charity and prosperity.

VISION

A networking group dedicated to the expansion of each members business through the power of referral. We collectively create business opportunities for each other as trusted professionals while sharing ideas to build relationships and help each of our members succeed.

results.description: If you are an aspiring writer, love to write to release stress or just like to write as a hobby, but don't really find yourself motivated, then join my group. I love to write, but I feel that its too hard to do it on my own. I feel that writing in a group environment keeps me motivated. Something about a deadline and a group to share and critique my work with makes me feel inspired. I started this group in hopes that I find local girls who share my interest in inspiring subjects to write about and sharing our work with each other in hopes that our compliments and critiques could help us all become better writers. How it works: a few girls meet up after being assigned a specific theme to write about. We share our stories and then give each other critiques and compliments. we can focus on anything that you feel you need extra help in. The reason why its a girls only group is for a few reasons. One: I find a lot of mixed meet ups tend to turn into a place to hook up, I do not want that, all I want are girls who want to write. Two: Sometimes its hard to share certain feelings and thoughts in front of the opposite sex, heck sometimes its hard to do it in front of same sex, so lets not make it double uncomfortable. And third: I run a girls only book club and I love the topics of some of our conversations, sometimes they are things that most guys wouldn't dare discuss with a girl and I kind of want to bring that openness into my writing group as well. I'm look forward to meeting some interesting writers!

results.description:
How does one live a good life?

This simple question can be surprisingly difficult to answer. Yet not taking an honest try at answering it (or even worse: ignoring the question entirely) can lead to the risk of misliving one's life. One of the main goals of ancient philosophy in the West was to help guide people in answering this question rigorously and well, and then helping people to live in accordance with their life's philosophy (literally "the love of wisdom").

One of the most successful and influential schools of thought in the ancient world which addressed this question was Stoicism. Stoicism taught that by cultivating personal excellence ('arete' in Greek) was all that was needed to lead a good life and flourish as a human being ('eudaimonia' in ancient Greek). To do this, the ancient Stoics taught a host of practices and a sophisticated theory of mind to help the Stoic student on the path to eudaimonia. Stoic philosophy had a huge influence on the West, from helping shape early Christianity to being a strong influence on the modern psychological movement of cognitive-behavioral therapy.

But Stoic philosophy is not only useful for those in the ancient world. For instance, James Stockdale has cited Stoic philosophy as helping him cope with the horrors of being a prisoner of war in Vietnam. Also, the University of Exeter in the UK has conducting pilot studies starting in 2012 of the effect of Stoic practices on various measures psychological well-being with promising preliminary results. Stoicism can be of great use to people in our modern era.

The goal of this meetup is to introduce Stoic philosophy as a way of life to people interested in living a more meaningful, tranquil life and to support experienced students of Stoic philosophy in their practice. While many of the meetups will be focused around reading, this is not a group for disengaged study of ancient philosophy from an academic perspective. Instead, this is a group for helping people to put Stoic philosophy into practice in their daily lives, so they can live the best life they can.

Are you ready to attempt to live a more tranquil, meaningful, and happy life? Then join us today!
results.name: New York City Stoics

results.description:
Dearest Seekers,

I am really excited to become the organizer of this group, thank you Eli for pointing me towards it and thank you Abby for bringing it thus far. Creating community is essential for recovery and "What we can't do alone, we can do together."
Say hi, introduce yourself and know you are never alone. I am in service and available to anyone on this path of recovery and who are willing, honest and open-minded. You can message me on meetup, by email cindee@cindeerifkin.com or text 917-402-6606. Who am I? I am a sober (11 years) woman living a life of gratitude and service. My addictions to alcohol, drugs, sex, porn, food, people and gambling brought me to my knees. I turned my struggles and pain into my greatest allies and I am hopeful you can too. I believe that my connection to the god of my understanding and daily self-care practices bring me the spiritual fitness I need to create defenses against my addictions because without them I am doomed. I romanced the Big Book as it has the clearest directions on how to recover from alcoholism and for me all my addictions. It is how I guide my sponsees to walk hand and hand with their HP and to live in the sunlight of their spirit. It is a sacred text just like Patanjali's Yoga Sutra or the Bhagavad Gita which I also have studied. I have become a Self-care Educator and I bring an array of skills to my clients that they use in their daily lives. Simple but not easy, we can complicate anything but with yoga and the 12-Steps, daily miracles are happening. Everything is a blessing and or an opportunity, I am no longer the victim of anything but the creator of everything. I hope you can join us on the road of happy destiny, a life of gratitude, joy, fun and freedom. In Beauty & Gratitude, Cindee
results.name: Yoga and 12-Step Recovery NYC

results.description:
Hello everyone and welcome!

A SOUND JOURNEY group meditation lasts between 60 and 90 minutes.

We begin with a guided yoga nidra meditation, which is followed by the Sound Journey itself. Then we finish with some integrative silence. At the end, I invite participants to share their experience to the group if they feel inspired to do so.

I use Didjeridoos, Tibetan Singing Bowls, Crystal Bowls, Keyboard, Percussion, and my voice.

For the entire experience, you lie down (or sit if you prefer) in deep relaxation and experience sounds' soothing vibrations, energizing presence, and healing power.

Although the structure remains the same, every session can vary greatly in content, length, and intensity.

I hope to see you soon!

Peace, 

Vincent 

p.s. I also offer private sessions.

p.p.s. With my wife, Kristin, we have another meetup,

http://www.meetup.com/Sound-and-Silence-Meditation/
results.name: Healing Sound Meditation and Relaxation

If you feel like you need someone to talk to, we are here for you. Sometimes it just helps to have someone listen, especially someone who is outside of your regular social circle. Sometimes it's good to hear feedback from others who've experienced similar issues. No problem is too small - if it's upsetting you then it's worth talking about and working on. This is a welcoming and open environment talk-therapy group for people of all ages with any issues they want to discuss.


An annual membership contribution of $25 is in effect starting January 1, 2015.
This contribution is for the entire 2015 calendar year and is meant to be paid at your first session, but no later than your second session, regardless of when in the year you join. Dues are collected via Paypal (message organizer for more info) or in person with cash. This is to offset the fee charged by Meetup.com to keep this group on the site, and any extra money raised will go back to the group (if and when that happens, it will be discussed in session).  To be fair, any existing or new member who does not contribute will be not be able to attend future sessions without contributing or working out an alternative plan with me. 
If you cannot afford $25 but would still like to be a part of the group, please message me!


This group is moderated by someone with personal experience dealing with and successfully managing depression and bi-polar disorder and who is well educated in the field of Psychology, however, THIS GROUP IS NOT RUN BY MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONALS.

results.description:
Kinding Sindaw (www.kindingsindaw.org) is a cultural performance troupe that has been in existence for over 20 years and is currently a resident artist group at La Mama E.T.C. Our mission is to educate and enlighten communities about the complex history and cultures of the indigenous peoples of the Philippines. Through the use of an artistic medium, which preserves the cultural heritage of the indigenous peoples from these regions, we seek to explore universal issues of the value of oral history, power, gender relations and environmental degradation that resonate with the current struggles of these indigenous peoples, but which also are shared concerns throughout the world. Since its founding, Kinding Sindaw has actively performed and provided cultural workshops and educational programs at venues throughout the city. These include full-scale dance-dramas: "Irimun o Banag", "Agama Niyog", "Rajah Mangandiri", "Lemlunay", "Sultan Kudarat", and "Bembaran". Venues have included La Mama ETC, Lincoln Center, The Puffin Room, Riverside Church, Mulberry Street Theatre, Wave Hill and NY area colleges. Additionally, we provide storytelling workshops at NYC area colleges, libraries (Jackson Heights Community Library) and museums (Met, Museum of Natural History, Asia Society). By presenting the rich and varied complexity of the indigenous peoples of the Philippines, we have been able to work with a variety of different community organizations and groups, and serve as a resource to help educate youth and adults.

In addition to existing workshops, Kinding Sindaw seeks to deepen and enrich the participant’s knowledge about Philippine history and culture, through a series of immersive arts and cultural workshops, led by Potri Ranka Manis, the founder and executive director of Kinding Sindaw. These workshops and classes will interweave the teaching of music, dance and martial arts movements with the history and struggles of the different indigenous tribes of the Philippines. Consequently, through this deep and active engagement, the participant will discover the tremendous significance of preserving the indigenous arts, culture, traditions and history of the Philippines, while becoming a tradition-bearer herself, capable of educating future generations and asserting her rightful place in our modern society.
results.name: Kinding Sindaw Cultural and Arts Educational Workshops
