results.description:
The group will create a safe space to explore touch through lecture, exercises, and discussions.

We will explore how to reconnect with ourselves with the end goal of reducing stress, and experiencing healing and more pleasure in life. We will include new and old modalities (massage, Tantra, eye gazing, Reiki) to go beyond physical touch to explore energy, communication and intimacy in its different forms.

As humans, we crave touch. Not only is it important for our emotional and mental health, but physiologically we need touch as well. Extensive research shows that a lack of touch increases stress and anxiety levels, which at chronic high levels may damage normal existing brain tissue and impede brain tissue development in children. This may be one of the causes of some learning difficulties many children experience.

Studies have shown that in some European countries, individuals usually touch one another 100 times in the course of an hour conversation. In the United States that figure drops to…..3, we can do better, and in this group we learn the mechanics of how this is achieved. In this group you will:

  • Become aware of the different forms of touch and how to utilize them for more connection and fun in life
  • Release tension and feel more relaxed
  • Understand more about boundaries and how to create and maintain healthy boundaries
  • Learn techniques of how to connect with others on many levels
  • Quiet the mind and come to your senses
  • Feel more alive and comfortable in your body
  • Increase your ability to communicate and create on many levels
results.name: Massage NYC - Explore-Touch-Connect

results.description: Personal Data NYC (PDNYC) is the largest Meetup on the east coast focused on the personal data revolution.  Founded in February 2013, we have 300+ members who meet monthly to discuss the implications (positive and negative) of a world in which personal data has gone digital . Meetings typically include product demonstrations, lively panel discussions, and networking over food, beer, and wine.  The vibe is casual, but attendees are well-informed, passionate, and highly engaged.  Our members are a diverse cross section of professionals from media conglomerates, advertising agencies, advertisers, start-ups, venture capital firms, privacy advocacy groups, research organizations, academia, government, and the press.   Past topics have included regulatory and legislative initiatives (e.g., CISPA, COPPA, Consumer Privacy Bill of Rights), current events (e.g., the Snowden/NSA revelations, the machinations around the Do Not Track standard), and broader conversations about the legal constructs of personal data and how to value personal data.
results.name: Personal Data NYC (PDNYC)

results.description: We are an LGBTQ peer-led discussion and support group dealing with emotional health and wellness. We provide a safe, open and non-judgmental environment encouraging members to listen to each other, share experiences, interact, and learn ways to cope, heal and grow, and make friends. We do this in an atmosphere of welcome, acceptance and empathy. We meet the 2nd Thursday of the month at the LGBT Community Center in New York City. We encourage members to talk from our own personal experience. We want the group to be a safe space and we encourage confidentiality, as much as is humanly and realistically possible. We encourage interaction, discussion and friendship, but we shy away from telling someone what they should do. We discuss anxiety, depression, OCD, loneliness, relationship issues, etc. We meet at a restaurant about two weeks after the center meeting. The restaurant is a less formal, more social get-together. We have recently added a support group meeting at a West Village church on the first Wednesday of the month. (The church has graciously offered us this space to use, but by no means are we advocating any particular religion.)The group is a joint effort among all members. The group is for LGBTQ people. We would like group attendance to reflect our diversity. We have a diverse group of facilitators with respect to gender, age, and ethnicity. If people want to get more info. about the group before joining, please e-mail at lgbtwellness411@hotmail.com. Thank you.
results.name: NYC LGBTQ SUPPORTIVE CONNECTIONS

results.description:
Welcome :)

Motherhood is the most rewarding experience most of us will ever encounter. As with all travels, many of us have taken different routes to achieve such a beautiful accomplishment. Those of us who embarked on such a journey later in life also understand the ups and downs of being an older mom.

The purpose of this group is to connect with other moms who are over 35 and moms to children ages 3 years and up. Being a mom can be sometimes overwhelming, but when coupled with being an older age mom it can be quite challenging.

Hopefully, the meetups will provide opportunities for us moms to create a concrete social support system; while ensuring a fun and safe environment for our little ones. My idea of a perfect group is one where members show the utmost respect for one another with the possibility of fostering harmonious friendships.

Let's get together for fun trips to parks, museums, puppet shows, music festivals and play dates at malls in the area in the Brooklyn, Queens and Manhattan areas. As everyone begins to get familiar with one another, we can later determine if whether fun events for just for mamas is also a feasible idea.

Hope to meet you soon!

~Marcy :)
results.name: With Age Comes Motherhood (New moms ages 35 and Be

If you've zoned out after 25 minutes of a tech talk and left the presentation remembering less than half of what you heard, this is your group. At Skillshare, we believe in learning by doing, so we're going to host regular Tech Skillshares for developers in NYC. Each Tech Skillshare will be led by a developer or leader in tech, and the format will be Learn (a quick talk), Do (you get to practice what you've just learned), then Feedback (time to mingle and share your work with the other attendees). We hope you'll join in and get your hands dirty!

Membership is by approval, and only technical people (with a focus on developers) are allowed to join.

Why, you ask? Because the goal is to have an ongoing learning group for technical people (esp. in startups) where they can level up and add to the skills they already have.

We meet on the first Monday of every month and have a speaker on relevant topics, from general topics, like how to create great engineering culture, to technology areas , like how to make the best use of Git.

results.description:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8kl2Lu5hhj0

This group is for people who value and enjoy deeper discussions with amazing people and who are also willing to rise to the occasion by joining us to help make these discussion opportunities an ongoing reality.

The events held in this group are all about having fun nights of great people and 'deeper' discussions over dinner in a charming restaurant. This Meetup group was created by Glen Brauer as part of a non-profit global initiative using practical philosophy to bring together strangers to build community. This Meetup group is now part of a network of over 6,000 members located in over 45 Meetup groups around the world. (Click here to view other locations).

 

Click here to view the upcoming topics for this year

Click here to view some pictures from previous events

 

Our events involve the following proven formula:

- open-minded individuals who are as intelligent as they are friendly

- 1 thought-provoking topic provided in advance so you have time to ponder it

- Food for Thought page provided in advance of event (click here for example)

- events are held in a charming restaurant

- restaurant is close to public transportation

- 6 people at each table (so everyone has a chance to speak)

- 1 discussion facilitator at each table (members take turns being facilitators)

- thought-provoking questions (discussion notes) are provided by Glen Brauer to the facilitators in order to stimulate the discussions.

 

The feedback from these events held around the world has been very positive. (Click here to view feedback). There are no membership fees but a small fee is required when signing up for events which goes towards Meetup costs, the time required to research and produce the discussions notes, booking restaurant reservations, scheduling the events, and coordinating the facilitators.

If this sounds interesting to you then click "Join Us" on the top-right of this screen then RSVP to events when they are posted. Members receive email notifications when new events are scheduled.

 

The Philosophy Dinners Facebook Group

The purpose of the Philosophy Dinners Facebook group is to cultivate the global citizen mindset; by enriching our perspectives through the sharing of insights before and after the events take place in our individual cities.

Click here to join the Philosophy Dinners Facebook Group
results.name: New York Philosophy Dinners

David Kinnear

results.description:
•What we do:

We introduce you to the potential of the Tanzanian experience anywhere you are. Through our online platform, event hosting, organizing and providing high quality travel service with a home touch but also contribute to telling various Tanzanian stories via our web-series. We are always growing however our goal to share our Tanzanian experiences with everyone who is interested in knowing more remains the same.

Who we are: 

We are as well curious people in search to learn and maintain our culture/heritage, all in a fun, educational, creative, relatable and adventurous ways. With more than 120 tribes, beautiful landscapes, national game parks, the rich history, and friendly people. We look to contribute and preserve our culture within and outside of our homeland.

We at Curious On Tanzania also look to collaborate with different partners to bring upon the seen and unseen experiences of Tanzania. Won’t you join us to discover Tanzania in a new way and spread the word of how beautiful our homeland is?

 

Inspired by the diversity among New Yorkers and her Tanzanian heritage, founder Justa Lujwangana, created “Curious On Tanzania” (COT), a social traveling platform that offers unique Tanzanian experiences within and outside of the country. 

COT’s mission is to inspire and fulfill ones curiosities while discovering the art, culture, and beauty of Tanzania in a gentle, friendly and accessible way. 

Be Curious On Tanzania! Join us for events, travels and/ or watch our stories our YouTube channel @ Curious On Tanzania.

This is a fun meetup group and everyone is invited to discover Tanzania in a new way.
results.name: Curious on Tanzania- Discover Tanzania in a new way. Tz-NYC

Are you curious about Jewish Meditation and other aspects of Jewish mysticism? Perhaps, you've studied different traditions, meditation techniques, practiced Yoga to achieve higher states of consciousness.  And now you wonder if Judaism has something to offer in that realm?

Most Jews are surprised to learn that there is such a thing as "Jewish" meditation. If you consider yourself "spiritual" and you'd like to learn how to use meditation and visualization techniques to improve your life, or share your knowledge in that area, consider joining us.

Together we will learn how to be more alert and aware much of the time

We will learn how to eliminate negative thoughts and negative moods which are harmful to our health.

We will learn how to raise our level of consciousness and be in harmony with those around us.

We will learn visualization techniques which will help attract into our lives the things we wish for (health, finding a soul-mate, financial success, etc.).

Hope to see you at one of our meetings soon...

results.description:
Who We Are


Are you a reporter, producer, editor, or broadcasting professional here in NYC or elsewhere? We would love to have you join us for in depth discussions about the role of the media, new technology, production techniques, interviewing and editing skills, or just to network with like-minded professionals.

 

New York Broadcasting Group is a non-profit organization that supports the New York media community. Our goal is to help build a sustainable media industry that drives economic growth, leads innovation, and creates positive, high-impact change for our local communities and the world.

 

Contact Information


nate@nateplutzik.com

Twitter: @NYBroadcast

 

What We Do


Connect * Explore * Inspire * Educate * Collaborate * Learn*

We connect members of the media community with each other and with resources to help them build and connect with successful, sustainable media companies. We amplify the work of the New York media community by providing platforms from which they can showcase their work or skills. We inspire innovation and growth by exposing the community to new ideas and leading-edge technology.

results.description:
Speak English. Make Friends. Be a New Yorker!

New York English is a diverse community of fun and friendly people. This group is designed for everyone who wants to improve their English in a fun and casual way. ALL LEVELS of English, from beginner to advanced, are welcome! We create events for each and all levels.

If you join New York English, you will enjoy participating in cultural events and conversation while practicing their English with a native English speaker, who is an experienced, friendly, and patient ESL teacher. We invite you to become a member and immerse yourself in BOTH language and culture, have fun and make tons of friends!

We plan different types of meetups for our members.
• Large informal English conversation events in Manhattan
• Smaller monthly workshops for each level (Beginners, Intermediate, and Advanced) that focus on conversation, pronunciation, grammar, and other tricky topics.
• Private movie screenings in English with subtitles and a social/conversation hour
• New York Culture! -- guided museum visits, walking tours, theater, dance, concerts, food and more!

There is a nominal charge (nonrefundable) for each event, primarily in order to discourage no-shows and to defray the cost of organizing meetup events.

Please join us in conversation groups, social events, and much more as you learn to English like a real New Yorker -- in real-life and fun situations.

Learn more about me at our website and Facebook page!

WEBSITE http://eslinstyle.wordpress.com/
FACEBOOK https://www.facebook.com/ESLinStyle

results.description:
There are a number of trends in the world that if left to follow their current course have the potential of becoming serious disasters.

  • Devaluation of Human Labor - decreasing ability to improve one's situation through human labor
  • Polarization of Wealth - decline of the middle class
  • Freezing of Classes - end of upward mobility
  • Impending Generational Conflicts over shrinking financial resources
  • Widening Gap between Education Haves and Have Nots and related disparity in economic opportunities
  • Climate Change (regardless of cause),
  • Impending Geopolitical Conflicts for Water and Food
  • ????

We can simply watch and throw up our hands in helplessness (maybe our generation will luck out and make it through ok - but what about our children/grandchildren?) or we can seek to do something about it.

Do something about it? Most think these problems are too big; it's hopeless.

We are not willing to be passive victims or leave our children and grandchildren to have to deal with what, by then, will be much larger problems.

If you are tired of ego charity (helping individuals without doing anything about the real problems) or projects so puny that they are the equivalent of peeing in the ocean to change its color or you are simply tired of all the talk and no meaningful action, please join us. Our goal is to mobilize the thousands to change the lives of millions. We have ideas! We have projects underway. All skills and ideas are welcome. Join us and work to make a real difference.
results.name: More than talk for a Better World

results.description: This is a group for those interested in getting support from others to live a healthy and optimal life. We live in an over indulging, unhealthy eating, and sluggish society. In this group you will get the support you need to eat healthy, exercise, think positively, and make friends who want the same thing, supporting positive friends for life. We are in our infancy stages as the group has just began, but I have faith that the group will be a strong, focused, tight knit group of members supporting each other in a very important goal, to be healthy inside and out. I encourage all members to have a Health journal where you mainly record any exercise activity you do through each week, record your weight (which you don't have to share at the meetings) and record your daily food intake. You can also jot down in your journal things you may have learned that you can share with the group. We will discuss different subjects at each meeting, ie: healthy eating, diet plans, food and health information, emotional eating, body image, exercise tips, renewing your mind to help you stay focused, plus many other topics. You will also have my support via phone call or email and the support of other members in the group. About Me and Why I started this Group: When I was younger I was very active and as I became older I realized how important it was to stay active and maintain a healthy lifestyle. I’ve always maintained a Nutritional Diet for the most part and practice eating healthy foods. But when I started to look around me I realized what an unhealthy society we live in and I want to help others achieve more than society's standard. So, as you and I know, it is so very difficult to do this alone. Most of us need encouragement and support and accountability. I am just like you all, down to earth and REAL~ We will begin this journey together. Currently there is not fee, this may need to change in the future, depending on the groups needs.  As the Organizer, I am here for you anytime to email or call me for anything you need, including suggestions, concerns, ideas, and questions.This is a group for anyone interested in starting or maintaining a healthy lifestyle and wishing to make new friends.
results.name: A Healthy You of Northern NJ

results.description:
This workshop/presentation series will cover design stretching from many areas: UI, UX, Wearables & Fashion, Web, algorithmic e.t.c through short expert talks and interactive design exercises. It will focus on growing fields in technology and how design plays a part in each of them. The free workshops, which are only for students, will meet Mondays at 5:30pm sometimes weekly, sometimes biweekly.

Design is about creating something to achieve a goal. Maybe you want to design an iPhone app to help people eat more healthily. Or maybe you want to create a piece of public policy to make financial markets more stable, or to structure an organization so that it operates more efficiently. Maybe you want to see how code and design are coming together to create user-friendly wearables or interactive installation. 

No matter what your goal, in order to achieve it, you’ll need to generate, implement, and evaluate various ideas and pick the best ones. Then you need to make them work. Design is the science for doing this.
results.name: Tech@NYU DesignDays

results.description:
The Society of Physician Entrepreneurs (www.sopenet.org) is a not-for-profit 501(c)6 global biomedical and healthcare innovation network. We use the term "Physician" loosely to include all who are in the healthcare world who have an idea or desire to improve it or make a contribution. This would include physicians, dentists, chiropractors, nurses, physician assistants, biomedical engineers, etc. Members include healthcare entrepreneurs, investors, service providers, and industry representatives. The mission of SoPE is to help biomedical and healthcare entrepreneurs get their ideas, discoveries and inventions to market by providing them with education, connections to service providers & investors.

We try to hold meetings every 2 months during the academic year from 6:30 -9:30. Typically we hold meetings in mid-town Manhattan but we are also trying to arrange meetings in Connecticut and New Jersey.

Meetings typically have three scheduled features: (1) networking; (2) subject presentation on business issues (e.g., finance, FDA, IP, marketing, etc.); and (3) a Company presentation by a member. We insist that at the meeting there be no solicitation of investments or business and dress code is business appropriate as one may see at a big law firm or financial services company.

Individuals may attend one meeting free as a guest of ours, after which you will be expected to join SOPE. SOPE membership entitles you to attend our chapter meetings for free. Potential business sponsors will be charged $100 to attend the first meeting and will have that amount deducted from sponsorship costs.

Please contact us for details.

Steve Levine         slevine@sopenet.net

Larry Kunstadt      lkunstadt@sopenet.net

results.description:
The Alternative Banking Working Group of Occupy meets every Sunday from 3-5pm at Columbia University, in Room 409 of the International Affairs Building at the corner of 118th and Amsterdam Avenue.

We typically get about 20 people (most of whom are on our e-mail list, not meetup).

We are open to everyone. If you are press, please identify yourself before the meeting begins. Also, we don’t allow any recording devices at the meetings, and if you want to quote someone you need their explicit permission for each quote.

To learn more about us, see our web site and for the sort of topics we discuss, the "News" page.

We usually send out topics on Saturday and ask for more topics. To get on the list please email alt.banking.OWS@gmail.com and request to be added to the email list for Alt Banking.

The format of the meetings are as follows:

  1. We list the topics and discuss them briefly to give people an idea of what they are.
  2. We vote for the topics to see who wants to discuss what.
  3. The top 2-4 topics are chosen, and we have two rounds of discussions in which people are free to choose whichever topic they choose.
  4. People take minutes and when the groups are large enough someone takes stack as well.
  5. After the two rounds, we have a quick summary of the discussions.

When we can get good speakers, we schedule them from 2-3 before the regular meeting.
results.name: Alternative Banking Group - Occupy Wall Street of NYC

Clear Mountain Zen Center opens many gates to living a Zen life, free from the constraints of delusion and for the benefit of all beings. Zen practice is both introspective and social. The benefits of Zen meditation include: - clarity of mind and increased self-understanding - greater compassion for yourself and for others - ability ot handle situations previously difficult to deal with - more creative approach to life - reduced stress and improved concentration - spiritual, emotional, and even physiologicasl balance - mindfulness of your actions, your surroundings, and your time - increased self-confidence and self-esteem

results.description:
This is a group formed by entrepreneurs for entrepreneurs.

Our Mission: The creation of a vibrant entrepreneurial community in New Jersey so that entrepreneurs have the necessary tools available to launch their startups.

Collaboration: We are a collaborative movement which is looking to work with any group that shares our passion for entrepreneurship. We are not in competition with NYC, Philly or any other group.

Necessary Tools:

• Developers & Business Development professionals: building blocks of an entrepreneurial community

• CoWork Spaces: Melting pots in which companies are started

• New Blood/Ideas/Energy: Collaborate with teaching institutions and make entrepreneurs who are working in silos aware of the community

• Educational Collaboration: Incubators, accelerator, entrepreneurial programs, STEM in high schools etc…..

• Investors: They don’t think we have enough quality companies in NJ to warrant their time. Let’s prove them wrong.

• Government: We don’t expect a lot but every little bit helps. Helping with cowork spaces is a good start.

Past & Present:

New Jersey is the home of Thomas Edison, Bell Labs and was the epicenter of the Pharmaceutical industry and Telco. We also have a highly educated population, great businesses, close proximity to NYC and/or Philly and a well-developed educational system. However, if you look at lists of top states for entrepreneurship and innovation New Jersey never makes it. The great thing is that this is showing signs of changing. NJ Tech, Jersey Shore Tech and Princeton Tech have proven, by their stellar growth, that New Jersey wants/needs an entrepreneurial ecosystem.

LaunchNJ (Not for profit):

Madison Tech has pivoted and is now called LaunchNJ. Our sole mission is the creation of an entrepreneurial community in New Jersey. This group is run by entrepreneurs for entrepreneurs so we figured it only made sense to run it like a startup. We will take chances, measure results and iterate or pivot as needed.

MVP:

Use the voice of LaunchNJ to support the creation of Special Interest Groups (SIG’s): (i.e. Life Sciences, Developers, Female Entrepreneurs)

Create events that provide high value for entrepreneurs: (workshops, deep dives, co-founder date night etc.)

Make members aware of events occurring around the state (aggregate)

Celebrate New Jersey company wins =’s create buzz

The Bottom Line:

New Jersey has all the building blocks necessary to build an entrepreneurial and innovation hub, the movement has started. Since this is a grassroots movement we need you. None of the organizers are getting paid but they are working hard to deliver high impact programs and will continue to do so. However, if we are to succeed we need your help. Please let other entrepreneurs or entrepreneurial people know about the group. It is a great opportunity for them to learn and you are helping your community.

Definitions:

Entrepreneurial: A person who sees a problem and fixes it without having to be told and is willing to share knowledge with others.

Entrepreneur: An Entrepreneurial Person who chooses to take the plunge and commit themselves 100% to something that has a high probability of failing.
results.name: LaunchNJ: Entrepreneurial Tech Hub

results.description:
What is Apache CloudStack?

Apache CloudStack is open source software designed to deploy and manage large networks of virtual machines, as a highly available, highly scalable Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) cloud computing platform. CloudStack is used by a number of service providers to offer public cloud services, and by many companies to provide an on-premises (private) cloud offering, or as part of a hybrid cloud solution.

CloudStack is a turnkey solution that includes the entire "stack" of features most organizations want with an IaaS cloud: compute orchestration, Network-as-a-Service, user and account management, a full and open native API, resource accounting, and a first-class User Interface (UI).

CloudStack currently supports the most popular hypervisors: VMware, KVM, XenServer,Xen Cloud Platform (XCP), LXC, and Hyper-V.

Users can manage their cloud with an easy to use Web interface, command line tools, and/or a full-featured RESTful API. In addition, CloudStack provides an API that's compatible with AWS EC2 and S3 for organizations that wish to deploy hybrid clouds. Learn more at. cloudstack.apache.org.

Join the CloudStack NYC Users Group

Anyone is welcome! Come and chat over pizza and drinks.

We will have talks from members of the foundation, committers, and users of CloudStack discussing various aspects of its development, history, architecture, operation and in general the direction of the project in this and upcoming meetups. And most importantly - how to get started on contributing yourself! Anyone is welcome to the group and we'll have beginner sessions available as well.
results.name: CloudStack NYC User Group

results.description:
"The constructed language with the most complete grammar is probably Lojban - a language created to reflect the principles of logic." --- Arika Okrent, the author of In the Land of Invented Languages

 

coi ro do (Hello Everyone!)

This group is for people who are interested in and want to know about the constructed language, Lojban.

Lojban is a one of the most complete, carefully designed, and logically unambiguous constructed languages in the world.

Lojban has a number of features which make it unique: (quoted from lojban.org)
- Lojban is designed to be used by people in communication with each other, and possibly in the future with computers.
- Lojban is designed to be culturally neutral.
- Lojban has an unambiguous grammar, which is based on the principles of logic.
- Lojban has phonetic spelling, and unambiguous resolution of sounds into words.
- Lojban is simple compared to natural languages; it is easy to learn.
- Lojban's 1300 root words can be easily combined to form a vocabulary of millions of words.
- Lojban is regular; the rules of the language are without exception.
- Lojban attempts to remove restrictions on creative and clear thought and communication.
- Lojban has a variety of uses, ranging from the creative to the scientific, from the theoretical to the practical.
results.name: Lojban NYC

results.description:
On Twitter: @eanewyorkcity
On Facebook: New York Effective Altruists
Web: effectivealtruism.nyc

Are you motivated to do something that makes the world a better place? Do you want to have the biggest impact you possibly can? We each have limited resources with which to affect the world. Figuring out how to invest these resources to accomplish the most good can be difficult, involving a lot of research, strategy, and math. Fortunately, we don't have to do it alone.

Effective Altruism is a growing movement of people looking to maximize their impact on the world. We take our moral obligations toward others seriously and look for ways to do good for others that wouldn't otherwise be done. Whether you consider yourself a dedicated effective altruist, are curious about the economic and philosophical ideas behind the movement, or just want to do a little more good on the margins, we invite you to join us!

If you'd like to read about some of the ideas behind Effective Altruism, a good place to start is the "Introduction" page on the Effective Altruism Forum website.
results.name: Effective Altruism NYC

results.description:
In Sri Sri Yoga, the techniques of Yoga are taught in a light, joyful and thorough manner – equally useful and suitable for different levels of Yoga students, from beginners to advanced.

Sri Sri Yoga beautifully combines all the following aspects –

  • Yoga Asanas/Postures – for the well-being of the body and mind (Hatha Yoga)
  • Pranayama – to awaken the kundalini & regulating the flow of prana (Kundalini Yoga)
  • Meditation – to nurture the mind and spirit (Raja Yoga)
  • Knowledge – practical wisdom to deal with the challenges of daily life (Gyan Yoga)
  • Satsang – singing and celebrating (Bhakti Yoga)
  • Seva – an opportunity to get involved in service projects (Karma Yoga)

Through powerful and enjoyable yoga process, you will come to contact with your body in a more intimate and profound manner. The process will take you through the unification of the mind, body and breath, you will experience deep relaxation and powerful recharge. You will acquire the key to yoga asana and settling of the mind, and will deepen your experience through practices and the guidance of the instructor.
results.name: Sri Sri Yoga

Free and Open to the public, Team Sadek’s is a non-profit and our mission is to help people begin, achieve and sustain a healthy lifestyle. A primary goal of ours is to show people just how easy this can be with a highly successful running program for beginning runners.　 We utilize a method developed by Kimberly Brennan, RN and Ultramarathoner called the Kimmy Shuffle. Team Sadek club members collectively have lost hundreds of pounds together. The Kimmy Shuffle running method breaks down the act of running making it easy and it is tailored to fit each person. The Kimmy Shuffle is taught and demonstrated at the beginning of every running clinic. Anybody can do this no matter their age, weight or level of ability (as long as your doctor has cleared you for physical activity like walking).

Team Sadek's non-profit has taken the 'I'm Running Proud' youth program under its umbrella.  The New Brunswick branch, 'New Brunswick Runs Proud,' is a partnership with New Brunswick Parks/Recreation and Rutgers Recreation that teaches empowerment/self-esteem, health and running via the Kimmy Shuffle to the next generation!!

results.description:
Health and Happiness is your birthright! So, Let's start from the beginning, shall we?! Let's get together for some life changing, energy stimulating, mind centering and soul awakening KUNDALINI YOGA and MEDITATION!

Kundalini Yoga has no beginning and no end, so what do I mean beginning Kundalini Yoga?? Kundalini Yoga is a Yoga of Awareness, so in this group we will approach yoga with a new and fresh look at Kundalini Yoga practice. Whether you are a new or seasoned practitioner, come and joins us and explore this ancient practice. It is for anyone searching for complete Union of Being: physical, mental, spiritual! It is for every body, age, physical ability. It meets you where you are at and takes you where you want to go!

Master the basis: Long deep breathing, breath of fire, eye focus, "the locks", mantra pronunciation and meaning, postures and mudras.

The Kundalini Energy is awareness itself. It organizes all the other energies in the body. If its flow is open and correct, healing results occur with almost miraculous impact. Our fears and attachments often disturb the normal flow of energy and functioning of the first three chakras. When that flow is opened and reconnected to the higher centers, the nervous system, glands and chakras all synchronize. A deep rejuvenation cascades throughout the body.

“Your mind is your servant, your body is your vehicle and your soul is your residence.” Yogi Bhajan

Hope to see you there!
results.name: Montclair NJ Kundalini Yoga and Meditation Meetup Group

results.description:
Attention entrepreneurs, aspiring entrepreneurs and existing business owners who need assistance. This is a fantastic opportunity for you to get in front of people who can help you.

Membership is by invitation only but you are welcome to apply as a presenter.

EAG is made up of seasoned entrepreneurs in various fields who work with entrepreneurs to help them build their businesses. We are passionate and want to help smart hard working people achieve great things. Members range from service providers (i.e. legal, marketing) to people who run Incubators and Accelerators.

We meet once a month to hear 1-2 entrepreneurs present their slide decks or business plans. The presentation is followed by a Q&A session and a detailed email giving feedback from multiple perspectives. There is no charge for this service and no one is pressured in any way to work with EAG members.

The opportunity allows the entrepreneur to clean up their presentation before they pitch to an investor or potential partners. It also allows them to start developing relationships with professionals they may need as their business grows. After the presentation one EAG member is designated as an internal driver to help the presenter. This includes everything from connecting them to beta testers, potential clients and/or investors.

If you are an entrepreneur or an aspiring entrepreneur and are interested in presenting please let me know and I’ll walk you through the process. Also, investors and professionals who specialize in working with entrepreneurs are invited to sit in as guest during the presentations.
results.name: Entrepreneurial Advisory Group (EAG)

Come sing!!! We're bringing people who love to sing together to form a community.

Gatherings, jam sessions and choir rehearsals incorporate singing together, learning music, some vocal technique and training, and community building exercises and games.

We're starting off less frequent and will build to more regular rehearsals/gatherings.

Music selections will be moving, enlightening, enlivening, conscious, healing, inspiring, non-denominational, fun, deep. All musical styles - gospel, pop, rock, musical theatre, chants, folk, medicine songs.

Musicians, singers - express interest by joining this group!

Prerequisites:
1) You love to sing
2) You love to play and create community
3) You are inspired by using your voice and music as a way of connecting with others

Do I have to be a "singer"?
No - you just have to love to sing!

Do I have to be on pitch?
No, but some more difficult or finely tuned songs with tight harmonies may be sung by sub-sets of our choir who have above average musicianship

 

Note from Amy : I used to be in a community choir at Sacred Center NY - we sang Gospel Style Music with new thought, inspirational lyrics. My favorite aspects of being part of the choir were - rehearsals, singing music that raised my consciousness and vibration, the healing of singing and making music with others, the close community formed. I did love our performances, but honestly got so much more out of our rehearsals and dinners-out and talks on breaks etc... I talk to so many people who love to sing - so let's come together and form something.

results.description:
Great Music Played By Anyone....For Everyone

New Westchester Symphony Orchestra is an ensemble where anyone can play the greatest orchestral music ever written.

Our Mission: The New Westchester Symphony Orchestra (NewWSO) offers amateur instrumental musicians in and around Westchester County an opportunity to build musicianship in a supportive, non-competitive setting while practicing and performing significant orchestral and ensemble works.

Who Can Play: NewWSO is an audition-free ensemble for musicians of all ages and abilities. Anyone who wants to play great works of orchestral literature can do so with us. When possible, we play from the exact same editions that the great orchestras of the world play from. So, next time you hear the first movement of Mozart's 40th Symphony being played on WQXR, you will recognize your part and say, "Hey, I can play that...sort of!"

Our Conductor: Conductor Benjamin Niemczyk is understanding, patient, and brings us together in the spirit of making great music. There are more than a few wrong notes here and there and he doesn't yell at us, we just keep trying. So come play with us no matter how long it's been. No need to brush up before playing with us, our friendly musicians will make you feel right at home.

One member's perspective:

 

Rehearsals and Concerts: We rehearse weekly and we play concerts in the community approximately once per month. Don't sweat either one, we're a relaxed bunch and know that people are busy. Just rehearse and perform when you can. Concerts are always volunteer, we don't make you perform. Visit our website for much more info on who we are, what we play, and where we play.

Join us at any one of our weekly rehearsals to check us out. You may not see many RSVPs here because most of our members are not on Meetup. You will walk into a room of 35-45 musicians when you come. Everybody is very friendly and welcoming, so don't be too shy. Just come!

What instruments do we need? Currently we have openings for following instruments:

  • Oboe
  • Bassoon
  • Violin
  • Viola
  • Cello
  • Bass

If you play flute, clarinet, trumpet, percussion, or piano, contact us regarding available spots as we may have a waiting list. That being said, if you play these instruments but also play another instrument or are willing to learn another instrument, we won't turn you away. We welcome musicians who have an adventurous spirit.

If you are a pro: We are an all-volunteer ensemble whose musicians do not get paid to perform, nor do we pay "ringers" to play with us. If you're a professional musician or a really awesome amateur and want to play with us, that's great! But we don't pay in cash, let's just get that out of the way. Your payment will be the great feeling of playing with a group of enthusiastic music lovers, and a little fame if that's your thing.

NewWSO is a 501(c)(3) tax-exempt organization and is a "pay to play" ensemble. Your first rehearsal is free of charge, to see if you like the repertoire and the people. If you decide to join, we ask for a contribution of $10/rehearsal OR a pro-rated annual contribution to cover rehearsal space rental and administrative costs. However, if a financial contribution is not possible for you, we can work something out. Please let us know your situation and we are more than happy to accommodate in a way that is fair for everyone.
results.name: New Westchester Symphony Orchestra

results.description:
NYC Data Engineering hosts events where the lead engineers from pre-screened companies showcase their technical challenges.
ONLY ENGINEERS can attend. If you are not an engineer, please be aware that you may be removed from the group.

Software engineers are presently faced with an ever-increasing amount of data as well as a plethora of options for open-source technologies to use to manage it. And the architectures required to process the data into useful information using machine learning, NLP, analytics, etc. are constantly evolving. The NYC Data Engineering Meetup tackles the real-world issues in data processing architectures. For our talks we invite top engineers with previous experience in building online, offline and nearline processing systems and ask them to tell us about lessons learned in building their architectures. We're also interested in the practical applications of data science and machine learning, and explore the best ways that current advancements in those fields can be worked into production level data-oriented architectures. If you're involved in data engineering or data science at any level and are looking for real-world engineering war stories on data processing architectures, please join us.

The goal is to provide each group (and their individual members) with a set of songs so that each member comes away with a their own repertoire. This is not a "group play-along" type meetup but rather one which teaches the member their own set of playable songs.

Our own experiences tell us that learning specific songs as a small group promotes quicker learning than practicing on your own.  Group work encourages the student to learn at their optimum level. Moreover, actually learning to play songs as finished products results in a rewarding experience.

results.description:
Welcome to Death Café New York City!

The idea of the Death Café comes from the work of Swiss sociologist Bernard Crettaz, who saw the concept as part of a set of projects about death called Impermanence. Founder Jon Underwood, in the UK, read about Crettaz's work in a newspaper article and in November 2010, opened the first known Death Café.

We adopt the European "salon" model of Death Café: free-flowing conversation around the topic of death from-any-angle. Openness is the only pre-requisite. Our chosen professions - Audrey in grief recovery and Nancy in the prescriptive arts -  makes us especially sensitive to the two biggest things that negatively impact health and wellness:

  • repressed emotional statements about loss and regrets and
  • doubts about one's coping strategies and belief systems.

As NYC's pilot Death Café, we attract a wonderfully curious bunch of both listeners and storytellers - ranging from death doulas and Reiki masters, anthropologists and Jungian analysts to filmmakers, professors and chaplains, retired cops, and social workers.

What distinguishes our Death Café?

  • We're a non-for-profit;
  • We meet in an accessible and respectful space, free of discrimination, where people can express their views safely;
  • Free of facilitators, guest speakers or talent shows;
  • With no intention of leading participants towards any particular conclusion, product, belief system, or course of action;
  • Drawing together individuals of every kind of spiritual/ philosophical/ religious/intellectual beliefs, pursuits or questions
  • Encouraging members to support one another and continue their conversations outside Death Café

See you soon?

Co-hosts Audrey Pellicano and Nancy Gershman
results.name: Death Café New York City

This group is for anyone who wants to learn to cook anything from the very basics to expanding their home cooking repertoire. I specialize in teaching simple, easily reproducible meals that are healthy, tasty and mostly quick to make! Many are family friendly and I throw some in that are definitely company friendly! Did your mom work and not get to teach you much about cooking? Did you grow up in a house that made mostly things from boxes and cans? Were you the youngest and got left by the wayside when everyone else was in the kitchen? Well come join us!! I will teach you what you need to know to become a good home cook. Feed your family and feed them well. Classes are usually $55 per class but if cost is an issue please call and talk to me! I give discounts for multi class registrations, groups, couples, kids etc. We make food, we eat it, we take some home! You will get your money's worth!!!

My goal is to share with you what I believe is an important life skill.(and share with you the passion that goes along with it!)

You see I also believe LIFE HAPPENS IN THE KITCHEN. All joys, sorrows, and big decisions in life happen in the kitchen or at table.  Come learn about food and all that happens where food is made!

My mottos are these....

"Life is all about the food... make it good!"

"Do not neglect to show hospitality to strangers, for thereby some have entertained angels unawares."

Ecclesiastes 8:15 Then I commended mirth, because a man has no better thing under the sun, than to eat, and to drink, and to be merry: for that shall abide with him in his labor all the days of his life, which God gives him under the sun.

In 2011, Marquita Smith came to a realization: that her life needed to change in order to grow. In developing a ritual to grow daily, she stumbled upon a new method of enlightenment by way of learning. Whether it was reading an inspirational article or discovering a new influential speaker, Smith found that constant elevation was essential for self-betterment. She decided to compile these thoughts and realizations to form HowIGrewToday.com.

How I Grew Today is a site dedicated to sharing growth and mindfulness in every day life. From new books and new recipes, to new meditations and affirmations, HIGT is a network of like-minded women (and men) who are looking to grow and extend those experiences to others. Please feel free to submit your own personal moments of growth to the HIGT community. We are always looking for new ideas and new ways to build with others. Life is all about being present. Let’s embrace this journey together.

results.description:
Welcome to 20-something Fabulous NY Ladies. This group is for all ladies living in New York City age 21-29 who are interested in making new friends and having a great time! Whether you just got here or are only now finally getting around to exploring this awesome city you now call home - this is the group for you!


NYC is an amazing town with tons of places for food, drinks, shopping and so much more to do. :D


If there's an event you wish to attend or a place you wish to check out (restaurant, pub, bar, boutique, gym, etc), feel free to post a suggestion and find others to join you from the group!  I'm open to most suggestions!

While our group has grown considerably over the past few months, we tend to have varied events - some with 20+, others under 10 ladies attending.   Rest assured - we all have fun :) I think if you end up spending more than 6 hours with certain people - you like the company :D

*** Please note : I try my best to ensure we have events that are fun and affordable/worth the money.  As a member of this group, I ask that you please honor your RSVP or cancel in a timely manner, and most importantly - please be respectful of other members.  Behaving in a manner that is rude, disrespectful and mean will not be tolerated.  I will kick out anyone who acts like  they are on reality TV and it's sweeps week.  As a member of this group, your actions and words should not reflect poorly on the rest of us.  Being kicked out/banned from an establishment is not lady-like.  Calling people names or making other members feel unwelcome because they look or seem different will not be tolerated.  I thought this was common courtesy, but apparently, it's not.  I'm very strict about this.***


I would like this to become a wonderful, supportive community.  Hence, I am seeking members who will be active.  At least come to the group page and contribute some feedback or attend an event at least once every few months.  Ladies inactive for longer than 6 months will be removed.  But you're always welcome to re-apply.


Looking forward to seeing you at our next event!


PS - Please have a real photo of yourself - not your dog/beach/etch-a-sketch.  Your request to join the group will be declined. I'm sorry but i need to make sure I have real people (specifically - real women) joining this group.  NO exceptions.

PPS- Businesses interested in promoting their products to my members - please contact me directly.  I will respond to businesses that have something i feel members might be interested in.  Please do not try to become a member. I will not accept you.  I will ban anyone i find who joined the group under false pretenses.

results.description:
Tagine provides live music and bellydance shows every week. To book your table please call 646-373-6265. To view our Moroccan cuisine menu please visit: www.taginedining.com

To book a private party call Marisa at: 646-373-6265 or email her at: taginedining@gmail.com.

If you are a performer and would like to perform at Tagine please contact Marisa at: taginedining@gmail.com with the subject "performing"

Like a rose that blossoms out of a sidewalk crack, Tagine sweetens the NYC theatre district with an exotic and alluring perfume. Moroccan lamps, handwoven berber textiles and cushy seating create an understated elegance. Habitues of the restaurant/lounge steep themselves in the Maghreb, sipping luscious orange blossom sangria, savoring fragrant tagines, entranced by belly dancers and hookah pipes. What a shock to step outside, following this amazing melange of sensory delights and find not camels and dunes, but rather midtown Manhattan!



Aside from the beautiful and comfortably decorated interior, Tagine's kitchen is dynamic, baking its own semolina bread daily, and encasing its own lamb merguez. A variety of 'Tagines' are featured at the restaurant. There are several different cous cous selections on the menu, and mouthwatering house specialties include "bastilla", a Moroccan pheasant pie, and "moquadimat," a selection of appetizers, ordered a la carte or as a mixed platter. Included in the wine list, is a diverse selection of Moroccan varieties, which delightfully accompany the menu. Don't walk away from your table without sampling "Halahwyat" the most delightful, hand rolled traditional confections and pastries, graciously served with mint tea or Moroccan spiced coffee.



We have been hosting, catering and entertaining palates and bodies for over 12 years. Our new location boasts a generous bar, hookah lounge, semi private room and, as always,  one of the lasting live music venues in Manhattan.  Our concept is the cohabitation of flavors, aromas, palettes and palates:)   The merging of cross cultural arts, artists performances while dining on slow, authentic and artisanal cuisine is our mission and brand.  Hence our namesake, Tagine- Share the Experience



We are the only artisanal Moroccan restaurant that has a variety of gluten free dishes on our in-house menu as well as an executive chef who can accommodate any dietary request.
results.name: Live Music and Bellydance Performances in NYC

results.description:
Scale Warriors are engineers and entrepreneurs pushing the limits of speed at scale. They are pioneers, open to possibilities, doing what has not been done before. They are innovators and inventors, modern day heroes breaking barriers, taking risks, facing fears, making mistakes, moving forward moment by moment, creating a new future for themselves, their teams, their companies, for people and the planet.

This group brings Scale Warriors together to hear about challenges building real-time big data driven applications, discuss NoSQL and distributed databases, emerging technologies, what works, what doesn't and best practices for operating internet-scale systems.

Read Scale Warrior stories.

results.description:
Psychology Tomorrow Magazine was created to respond against the current trend in psychology towards medical or scientific explanations and of pathologizing human behavior. It explores the practice of psychology as an art in all its complex possibilities. The magazine goes a step further by looking at the relationship between psychology and contemporary visual arts, photography, fashion, writing, dance and film.

Psychology Tomorrow Meetup will bring together NYC's art and psych communities to explore the rich intersection of art and psychology.
results.name: Psychology Tomorrow MeetUp: NYC

results.description: Remember the days of photocopy zines? Thinking about starting your own webcomic? Want to start an autobiographical journal comic? Or work on your magnum opus of a graphic novel? The Indie Comics Collective (of NYC) is a group that will aim to provide a space for work collaboration, constructive criticism, inspiration, and of course, socialization. There are several meetup groups in the city that focus on getting together and talking about comics, but relatively few that focus on making comics and comics collaboration. This group will provide outlets for folks to work together, inspire each other, and even perhaps, publish together. In addition to drawing and writing sessions (at cool coffeeshops and bars! Or at member's personal favorite hangouts), we'll also try to hit up comic book release parties together, conventions in the area that focus on indie/web graphic novelists (think MoCCA and Small Press Expo), and you know, other fun stuff. This group is new! And in need of suggestions (especially for cool drawings places...good lighting and good drinks needed) - so please contribute
results.name: Indie Comics Collective

results.description:
Are you:
- Passionate about stereoscopy?
- A stereoscopic 3D professional?
- Interested in 3D and want to find out more?
- Or, have you never experienced stereo vision?

Join the new 3D Club of NY and enjoy the magical world of stereoscopic 3D!

We are a group of passionate Stereographers organized to promote the art, practice, enjoyment and science of Stereoscopic 3D (S3D) imaging. We'll conduct scheduled open meetings (with 3D projections and programs), events, workshops, competitions, exhibitions, labs, discussions, forums and many other social activities.

We welcome 3D content creators, fans of cinema, gamers, software developers and manufacturers. Whether you enjoy View-Master® images or experiment with the latest S3D hardware & software, you're encouraged to join our growing organization.

Come exchange ideas. Collaborate on projects, demonstrate your products, promote your business and share your knowledge. Discover the stereoscopic past and help to shape it's future. All are welcome: from the curious to amateurs to advanced specialists.

Historically, broad acceptance of 3D has been limited by analog technologies. Presenting stereo images was problematic and the results caused eyestrain and headaches. But emerging digital capture and display technologies are revolutionizing stereoscopic content creation and delivery.

An exciting era of Stereoscopic 3D imaging has begun and S3D is a rapidly growing market. Stereoscopy is the most natural method of visualization and there is an ever increasing demand for S3D content and services.

S3D has practical uses in numerous professional fields including, architecture - real estate - art - entertainment - medical - science - education - training - marketing - gaming - publishing - product design - manufacturing - data visualization. It opens up new possibilities for creativity and exciting new business opportunities.

The goal of the 3D Club of NY is to cultivate and advance the art of Stereoscopy by providing a creative hub for the Greater New York Area and linking it to the global S3D community.

 Your participation and input will drive the club forward. Come join us!
results.name: 3D Club of NY

results.description:
Whether you have a gym membership or not, there comes a time when you need to switch things up and try something new. I’ve felt that way before, so I thought about getting people together to do it with me (and hopefully at a discount!). All fitness levels are welcome!

 

Getting different gyms and personal trainers on board, I hope to bring a variety of classes to everyone. With strength in numbers, anything is possible, right?! So we’ll push each other in different settings, share our passion for health and fitness, and sweat a lot while having fun along the way.

 

Classes will include Cross-Training, Cardio, Strength, HIIT, and Core training along with Pilates, Yoga, and Spin. It’s up to you where this MeetUp goes! I’m looking forward to bonding over grueling workouts with all of you.
results.name: “Work Us Out NYC” New Group Fitness and Training Classes

results.description:
This is a group of women who like to hang out and have a great time in this wonderful city of New York!!! We are real and down to earth women who know how to also embrace our inner fabulousness! Yup, it is possible! :) This group is open to truly exploring what this city has to offer! We are between the ages of 30 & above years old. Anything from visiting an art gallery for a little culture, visiting a quick wine tasting event to enrich the palate, a girl’s night out at one of the local clubs for some dancing and flirting with the grown and sexy men of NYC (LOL), a fun TV night to watch and enjoy a “guilty pleasure” like the "The Real Housewives of Atlanta" or "Let's Talk about Pep", get together for some relaxation and pampering at the Spa, enjoy a movie and lunch, meet up for a nice happy hour after a crazy day at work, gather for a game night, go skating at the local roller rink (LOL), be adventurous on some skis, attend some professional networking events to share with the city our various career talents, strengthen the core with some yoga classes, put those feet to work with some dance lessons, work out parties to help keep us all motivated when we need it, single ladies attend some speed dating events, check out a Murder Mystery, Play, Comedy Shows, Concerts, etc … the list goes on!!! :)

So hopefully I will see you at the next meetup.....
results.name: FABULOUS GIRLFRIENDS SOCIAL (MANHATTAN-BRONX-BROOKLYN)

results.description:
Come Together For Health™

Improving access to affordable healthcare by promoting innovative technologies that transform healthcare.

Health Technology Forum (HTF) is a platform for people worldwide who have a common interest in making healthcare better, more accessible and affordable. Our international network of technology and healthcare entrepreneurs, developers, regulators, and providers are advancing the pace of healthcare innovation by engaging in exciting and productive dialogue between experts in healthcare.

Worldwide interconnections are critical as we think global and act local. The advent of PHRs, social network, open platforms, smart phone, personalized medicine, compliance, interoperability, and policies are creating new opportunities for everyone to engage in a dialog to improve care everywhere.

At our local meetups we discuss real-life technology use-cases from hospitals, doctor offices, medical billing, insurance, remote monitoring, pharmaceuticals, health-and-wellness, and various patient-care services. Subject matter experts, users, entrepreneurs, regulators, and providers will address each other's needs and solutions. The objective is to connect entrepreneurs with professionals who are addressing these real-life problems that exist in the healthcare ecosystem. We will review how affordable, scalable, deployable systems can meet or exceeds the needs of 21st century care-giving for everyone.

To learn more, please visit our website: www.healthtechnologyforum.com
results.name: Health Technology Forum: New York City

results.description:
As salamo alaikum, This is a group for Non-Muslims ( curious to learn about islam ), Muslims ( Reverts, Converts and Born Muslims ). The aim of creating this group is to understand Islam in the light of Quran and the teachings of the Holy Prophet(p.b.u.h) and his family, God willing/inshAllah, to gain the pleasure of God and seek nearness to Him. Let's educate ourselves about the beauty of Islam and bring it deeper into our lives. Islam is the religion of knowledge, it is a guide to the straight path from darkness into the light. The first aayah of the Qur’an to be revealed enjoined reading which is the key to knowledge. God/Allah (SWT) says: “Read! In the Name of your Lord Who has created (all that exists). He has created man from a clot (a piece of thick coagulated blood). Read! And your Lord is the Most Generous. Who has taught (the writing) by the pen. He has taught man that which he knew not” [al-‘Alaq 96:1-5] Islam calls us to seek knowledge. The Prophet (PBUH) made seeking knowledge an obligation upon every Muslim. The Prophet of Allah (saaw) was asked: “What is Knowledge?” He replied: “to keep silent”. He was asked: “Then?” He said: “to listen attentively”. He was asked: “Then?” He said: “to remember”. He was asked: “Then?” He said: “to act upon (what is learned)”. He was asked: “Then?” He said: “to propagate”. [Al-Majlisi, Bihar al-Anwar, vol. 2, p. 28] There is no goodness in knowledge which is not confirmed by action, or words which are not confirmed by deeds:Allah says: “O you who believe, why do you say what you do not do? It is most hateful to Allah for you to say what you do not do.” [Sûrah al-Saff: 2-3] So let us learn Islam : the perfect way of life and and bring it into our deeds and actions. May God guide us to straight path/siratal mustaquim ishAllah. Welcome to our group! Please feel free to post any suggestions or comments. May God Bless you/Jazakallah khair !!!
